short_message: Celebrates the spirit of student innovation in all the fields of engineering, science, technology, and design through extremely affordable/frugal solution,
message:
Celebrates the spirit of student innovation in all the fields of engineering, science, technology, and design through extremely affordable/frugal solution, Gandhian Young Technological Innovation (GYTI) Awards were given to those who had the courage to push the technological edge. Dealing with numerous aspects like communities at grassroots, co-creation with grassroots innovators, manufacturable technologies for saving or generating energy, sanitation, water purification, saving material consumption, biotechnology and medical devices, diagnostics, assistive devices for physically challenged, and all others areas of social and industrial applications, overall 23 awards were given to students of various Indian institutes. Bikash Ranjan Tiwari and Md. Tabish Noori from IIT Kgp while working under the guidance of Prof. Makarand Madhao Ghangrekar received this award
Award summary is as follows :
• IIT Madras – 3
• IIT Bombay - 3
• IIT Delhi - 3
• IIT Kharagpur - 2
• IIT Hyderabad - 2
• Institute of Chemical Technology Mumbai-2
• IIT Kanpur - 1
• IIT Roorkee - 1
• IISC Bangalore - 1
• IIT Guwahati -1
• Tezpur University, Assam -1
• National Dairy Research Institute, Bangalore -1
• Dr D.Y. Patil Vidyapeeth Pune - 1
• Don Bosco High School Assam - 1

short_message: Founded by Deepak Malhotra and Rajan Bajaj, SlicePay is a digital payment platform which was founded with a mission to simplify payments for the young.
message:
Founded by Deepak Malhotra and Rajan Bajaj, SlicePay is a digital payment platform which was founded with a mission to simplify payments for the young. Rajan Bajaj is an IIT Kharagpur alumni who graduated from the institute in 2014 with a degree in Civil Engineering. Rajan Bajaj, Co-Founder and CEO of SlicePay says, “Students’ spending power has significantly increased over the last few years as Indian parents now spend more on education, leading to a strong need for a frictionless lending solution for millennials”. We got an opportunity to interact with him.

http://awaaziitkgp.org/ky...

short_message:
'है नमन उनको कि जो यशकाय को अमरत्व देकर,
इस जगत के शौर्य की जीवित कहानी हो गये हैं |
है नमन उनको कि जिनके सामने बौना हिमालय,
जो धरा पर
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 14 new photos — with Venkappayya Desai and 3 others.
message:
'है नमन उनको कि जो यशकाय को अमरत्व देकर,
इस जगत के शौर्य की जीवित कहानी हो गये हैं |
है नमन उनको कि जिनके सामने बौना हिमालय,
जो धरा पर गिर पड़े पर आसमानी हो गये हैं |'

Yesterday, on the account of Shaheedi Diwas, a rally was organized by Samvaad in association with Technology Students' Gymkhana, followed by a Kavi Sammelan by Technology literary Society. The rally, which started at Gymkhana and concluded at the Nehru Museum, was full of enthusiastic sloganeers who enchanted patriotic slogans like 'Vande Mataram', 'Bharat Mata ki Jai'. At Nehru Museum, proceedings started with the National Song, followed by words of Bhagat Singh which reads as, ' They may kill me, but they cannot kill my ideas. They can crush my body, but they will not be able to crush my spirit '. Further, the anchor narrated the history of Hijli detention camp and two freedom fighters who were hanged there (Hijli detention camp)- Santosh Kumar Mitra and Tarkeshwar Sengupta. Thereafter, the president of the event, Prof Virendra Kumar Tewari (Agriculture & Food Engineering Department) spoke about the comparison between the mentality of those youth freedom fighters with nowadays youth about freedom. Then he welcomed Chief Guest of the event, Commander Veerendra Kumar Jaitely, an IIT Kgp alumnus.

Commander Jaitely saluted the brave freedom fighters and then told about one shaheed of IIT Kharagpur, V.K.Jain (INS Khukri) from Electronics Department, 1966 Batch. He gave an idea about the fight for freedom and inspired us to fight for our country for taking it to the top. Thereafter, Kavi Sammelan began which witnessed many extremely talented students recite their verse. The event concluded with the National Anthem.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur encourages student community to conduct more such events and actively participate in it!

In an attempt to build indigenous technologies for commercial usage our institute is working on developing an ecosystem of budding technical entrepreneurs.
message:
In an attempt to build indigenous technologies for commercial usage our institute is working on developing an ecosystem of budding technical entrepreneurs. One such project on Rain and Fog removal from Video Sequences has been taken up by Prof. Sudipta Mukhopadhyay and his team. Patents have been filed in US, Europe and South Korea. Basic application has been shown to work and is being approached by the world top leaders in Defence and Transportation. To scale up the work and improve the commercial viability of the product interns are being hired to work in the following related fields. Interested and enthusiastic students are invited to fill in the google form below. They will be invited to the recruitment drive soon.

https://goo.gl/forms/Dn5i...

Interns required in the following domains : Product Development, Android Programming, CUDA C, Image Processing, Machine Learning

Eligibility : Anyone interested is invited
Time Period : Summers 2018 and beyond
Stipend : Will be provided on the basis of alloted work

For any queries you can contact Professor Sudipta Mukhopadhyay, Department of E&ECE, IIT Kharagpur.

short_message: In an attempt to build indigenous technologies for commercial usage our institute is working on developing an ecosystem of budding technical entrepreneurs.
message:
In an attempt to build indigenous technologies for commercial usage our institute is working on developing an ecosystem of budding technical entrepreneurs. One such projects on 'Rain and Fog removal from Video Sequences' has been taken up by Prof. Sudipta Mukhopadhyay and his team. Patents have been filed in US, Europe and South Korea. Basic application has been shown to work and is being approached by the world top leaders in Defense and Transportation. Another projects in progress are 'Development of Biometric Authentication systems'. To scale up the work and improve the commercial viability of the product, interns are being hired to work in the following related fields. Interested and enthusiastic students are invited to fill in the google form below. They will be invited to the recruitment drive soon.

Interns required in the following domains : Product Development, Android Programming, CUDA C, Image Processing, Machine Learning

Eligibility : Anyone interested is invited
Time Period : Summers 2018 and beyond
Stipend : Will be provided on the basis of alloted work

For any queries contact: Prof. Sudipta Mukhopadhyay, Department of E&ECE, IIT Kharagpur

Application form link : https://docs.google.com/f...

message:
Presenting to you our first leader, the CEO of the largest Indian-owned management consulting firm- Tata Strategic Management Group, Mr Modan Saha. Having worked in companies like Axis Bank, Tata Consultancy Services, ICICI Bank, UBS, Mr Modan Saha completed his graduation from IIT KGP in 1993 and then went on to pursue his post graduation from IIM Calcutta.

short_message: “Sound Ideas and true innovation are meant to change the world”. Showcasing their enthusiasm and inclination towards innovations, our team 'Fire-Axe' was
story: ProDex is with Puneet Pachauri and 7 others.
message:
“Sound Ideas and true innovation are meant to change the world”. Showcasing their enthusiasm and inclination towards innovations, our team 'Fire-Axe' was announced as the winner of Product Design competition 'PROD-D' which was organized by Prakriti, IIT Kharagpur on 17th March 2018. The product is a farm machine which aims to reduce the widespread burning of farm residue that serves as a prime contributor to the alarming pollution levels in the capital city.
In turn, it promises to turn the waste into a potential economic resource for the farmers. The team is working hard towards the prototype and implementation of the solution. We congratulate the team for their efforts towards solving this global challenge of air pollution and climate change.
PC: Vipul Banjarey

short_message: International Relations Cell is delighted at the success of MS/PhD seminar organized on Sunday, 18th March. Students who aspire to pursue higher education
story: International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos — with Gaurav Gardi and 5 others.
message:
International Relations Cell is delighted at the success of MS/PhD seminar organized on Sunday, 18th March. Students who aspire to pursue higher education in future turned out in huge numbers and the panelists made sure that they explain the whole application procedure and enlighten them about the various aspects concerned with application for MS and PhD. All in all, we really hope that the students who attended the seminar were motivated and inspired.
Here are a few glimpses of the seminar.

short_message: Heard proses of Premchand, Jonathan Swift, or Tagore with regular or no rhyme scheme? Must have!! and also tried your hand at writing some too! If
story: Technology Literary Society - TLS, IIT Kharagpur added an event.
message:
Heard proses of Premchand, Jonathan Swift, or Tagore with regular or no rhyme scheme? Must have!! and also tried your hand at writing some too! If you get a kick from that, then get ready to witness the whole essence of poetry and prose in a tiny beautiful packet of Ghazal as TECHNOLOGY LITERARY SOCIETY, on the occasion of World Poetry Day, invites you to the very first Ghazal Workshop of our campus.
We'll discuss the etiquettes and aesthetics of a ghazal, starting our journey from Amir Khusro to Meer to Ghalib, followed by a beautiful evening of Ghazal recitation by the ‘Shaayars’ of our own campus!
Date: 06:00PM
Time: 21-03-2018
Veunu: Kalidas Auditorium

We'll discuss the etiquettes and aesthetics of a ghazal, starting our journey from Amir Khusro to Meer to Ghalib, followed by a beautiful evening of Ghazal recitation by the ‘Shaayars’ of our own campus!

short_message: National Digital Library of India(NDLI) developed by IIT Kharagpur is focusing on forging collaborations with digital libraries in the US and Australia,
message:
National Digital Library of India(NDLI) developed by IIT Kharagpur is focusing on forging collaborations with digital libraries in the US and Australia, as part of its second phase of development.Through collaborations, NDLI is looking at strengthening its own content, technology and business model, poised to lead internationally on key areas related to Digital Libraries including digital rights.
Read more at: https://economictimes.ind...

short_message: EPF (Ecole polytéchnique féminine ), France -  Graduate School of Engineering is organizing a 3 week in Smart CITIES & ENGINEERING for Sustainable Architecture
message:
EPF (Ecole polytéchnique féminine ), France - Graduate School of Engineering is organizing a 3 week in Smart CITIES & ENGINEERING for Sustainable Architecture from July 2nd to 20th 2018.
The Program is open to students of all domains of engineering and architecture.
The students must submit:
1. CV
2. NOC from college.
3. Copy of College ID card, etc.
All info for the program available at the following link:

https://drive.google.com/...

http://www.epf.fr/en/engi...

Students must apply for the program online at:

http://www.epf.fr/en/form...

short_message: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. Let us enjoy every second of our existence and help others enjoy in whatsoever way
message:
Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. Let us enjoy every second of our existence and help others enjoy in whatsoever way we can because a smile doesn't cost us, but it means the world to many.

The International Day of Happiness is celebrated every year on 20th March to recognise the importance of happiness, well-being and kindness in our lives. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a fruitful day of happiness.

short_message:
We come across a lot of problems, get stuck in some complicated chains and have a lot of queries every single day!
Whom should we turn to?
The
message:
We come across a lot of problems, get stuck in some complicated chains and have a lot of queries every single day!
Whom should we turn to?
The answer is here! Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur has launched the Support Cell, an initiative of the current Vice-President, Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur, Mr.Mayank Srivastava. The cell would serve as the first node of information for any doubts relating to various important domains of student life ranging from mess and maintenance to mental health!
Upon approaching, this team of individuals will enlighten you regarding procedures in the respective domains and respective person(s) in-charge. The current team lead by Krushi Bandi and Yashasvi Kanchaguntla will serve its term until August, 2018.
Hope you all use the service of the team to the best!

Head on over to this link to register: https://tinyurl.com/y6vtj...

short_message:
Code Club, IIT Kharagpur shared their post.

Microsoft is back with their flagship coding competition code.fun.do. Following last year’s
story: Code Club, IIT Kharagpur shared their post.
message:
Code Club, IIT Kharagpur shared their post.

Microsoft is back with their flagship coding competition code.fun.do. Following last year’s format all the 1st and 2nd year UG students need to compete in an online Hackathon out of which three teams will qualify for the final Hackathon. Attendance in the bootcamp is mandatory for UG 1st and 2nd year students.

The online hackathon will be held between 6th March to 12th March whereas the on-campus round will be held over-night on March 24 9:00 AM to March 25 2:00 PM.

Important registration deadlines : -
-> Bootcamp - Registration - March 2, 11:59 PM
-> Code.fun.do Online Qualifier - Team creation - March 8, 11:59 PM, Project Submission - March 12, 11:59 PM
-> Code.fun.do On-campus - Team creation - March 21, 11:59 PM

Registration link: https://aka.ms/cfdiitkgp

short_message:
Quarterfinals || Lawn Tennis || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports & Games

Quarterfinal 1: MMM vs HJB (2-0)
1.In singles, Suramya Pandey
message:
Quarterfinals || Lawn Tennis || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports & Games

Quarterfinal 1: MMM vs HJB (2-0)
1.In singles, Suramya Pandey (MMM) beat Akhil Andasu (HJB) by 7-5, 3-6, 6-3 in a hard-fought contest.
2. Suramya Pandey and Anshuman Kumar (MMM) defeated Sanket Mondal and Manish Dutta (HJB) by 6-2, 6-3 in doubles encounter.

Quarterfinal 2: Azad vs RP (2-1)
1. Kunaal Punj(Azad) handed an easy defeat to Rajat Gupta (RP) by 6-3, 6-0 in the first singles match.
2. The duo of Kunaal Punj and Nishant Kumar (Azad) lost to Mihir Kirloskar and Rajat Gupta of RP in doubles encounter by 5-7, 4-6 in a close contest, thus leading to a decider singles match.
3. In the last match, Nishant Kumar from Azad defeated Mihir Kirloskar from RP by 6-4, 6-3 helping Azad qualify for the semifinals.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams and wishes them all the best for semifinals.

short_message: What after graduation? It’s quite confusing for any student with numerous possibilities in corporate jobs and higher education. Provided both of them possess
message: What after graduation? It’s quite confusing for any student with numerous possibilities in corporate jobs and higher education. Provided both of them possess opportunities of their own kind with them, it’s immensely helpful to start thinking at an early stage. International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is organising a Panel Discussion with the graduating students who have secured MS/PhD offers from various renowned foreign universities. Besides, the panel will be guiding the students through the application procedures for MS/PhD in various universities. Be there to get your doubts cleared regarding higher education!

message:
Semi-finals || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Hockey

NH vs RP (3-0): Nehru defeated RP by 3-0 as their tough defence did not let RP open their account. With this, Nehru qualified for the finals.

PH vs RK (2-0): PH booked the final berth by handing over a 2-0 defeat to RK.

With this, we have got our two finalists of the Inter-hall Hockey Competition. With NH vs PH in the finals, it is expected to be a tough game and both teams are expected to give their best. 3rd place play-off will be played between RP and RK.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams and wishes them all the best for their upcoming match!

message: What after graduation? It’s quite confusing for any student with numerous possibilities in corporate jobs and higher education. Provided both of them possess opportunities of their own kind with them, it’s immensely helpful to start thinking at an early stage. International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is organising a Panel Discussion with the graduating students who have secured MS/PhD offers from various renowned foreign universities. Besides, the panel will be guiding the students through the application procedures for MS/PhD in various universities. Be there to get your doubts cleared regarding higher education!

short_message:
“ The value of higher education is the not learning of many facts but training of mind to think.”
-Albert Einstein

The world is definitely
message:
“ The value of higher education is the not learning of many facts but training of mind to think.”
-Albert Einstein

The world is definitely a humongous stage and all humans are merely players, where the ultimate fight is for power acquisition. Everybody wants to acquire fame and engraved his / her name in the golden books of history.If statistics is taken into picture be it Mrs.Indra Nooyi, Dr. Sashi Tharoor or Dr. Manmohan Singh each of the successful Indians has one thing in common: they all are highly educated. In such times, it becomes essential for students to decide whether to pursue higher education or go for corporate jobs. International relations cell, therefore, presents the MS/ Ph.D. panel discussion to help students clear all their doubts regarding MS/ Ph.D. application procedure. Hope to see you see there!

short_message: HOMECOMING is a time of absolute delight for the Institute, for alumni and their families. Old friends reach out to one another, make new friends and walk
message:
HOMECOMING is a time of absolute delight for the Institute, for alumni and their families. Old friends reach out to one another, make new friends and walk together through the roads, bylanes of the campus and the halls of residence to relive a time gone by.
We have been receiving a lot of messages from the alumni of 2003 and 2008 batches requesting to postpone the dates of Homecoming 2018.
We understand that this is a festival where you would wish to meet many of your batch mates and would not like to leave anyone out. To accommodate more and more alumni for the reunion, the Homecoming 2018 which was going to be held on 24th - 25th March 2018 has been postponed to be held from 17th - 19th August, 2018.
To add to this joy, we will also have Class of 1998 gracing the occasion!
Looking forward to welcoming you back to your Institute.

short_message:
“If there’s something you want to build, but the tech isn’t there yet, just find the closest possible way to make it happen.”

To apply for
message:
“If there’s something you want to build, but the tech isn’t there yet, just find the closest possible way to make it happen.”

To apply for this internship- http://bit.ly/MARKETINGKG...

Global Entrepreneur is a purely technical internship program that provides the students an opportunity of enhancing their skills in fields of their interests by working in a startup in a foreign country for 6-8 weeks.

Some of the categories provided are:

Data Analytics
Web Development
Programming
Engineering (specific to mechanical, civil, electrical)
Architecture
Finance
Marketing
Business development
Game development

Process :
Go through the regularly updated sheet of projects available ( http://bit.ly/GEIITKgp )

Meet an AIESECer in IIT KGP.

Create an account on opportunities portal of AIESEC ( www.aiesec.org )
Apply for projects
Skype interview with a startup of your liking
Pay administration fee = Rs.18,000 on approval
Book your flight tickets, apply for visa, get your travel insurance and ISIC
Attend the Outgoing preparation seminar
Have an amazing internship!

To know more about technical internships, register here:

short_message: “ The value of higher education is the not learning of many facts but training of mind to think.”
story: International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is with Asish Koruprolu and 3 others.
message:
“ The value of higher education is the not learning of many facts but training of mind to think.”
-Albert Einstein

The world is definitely a humongous stage and all humans are merely players, where the ultimate fight is for power acquisition. Everybody wants to acquire fame and engraved his / her name in the golden books of history.If statistics is taken into picture be it Mrs.Indra Nooyi, Dr. Sashi Tharoor or Dr. Manmohan Singh each of the successful Indians has one thing in common: they all are highly educated. In such times, it becomes essential for students to decide whether to pursue higher education or go for corporate jobs. International relations cell, therefore, presents the MS/ Ph.D. panel discussion to help students clear all their doubts regarding MS/ Ph.D. application procedure. Hope to see you see there!

Finals || Football || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports & Games

BRH vs JCB: 1- 0

The breathtaking finals witnessed a tight
message:
Finals || Football || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports & Games

BRH vs JCB: 1- 0

The breathtaking finals witnessed a tight play from both the teams throughout the match. Each of the teams left no stone unturned to score a goal against each other but the game came to the end with a single goal from Dampuia Fanchun (BRH) that led BRH to conquer the Gold and JCB had to content with the Silver.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the teams for their excellent performance!

Players who outshone in different categories are as follows:

Man of the Tournament: Dampuia Fanchun (BRH)
Man of the Match: Ritabrata (BRH)
Leading Goal Scorer: Chetan Rana (LBS)
Best Defender: Vasant Kumar (LBS)

Following are the final standings of the Football:

Gold: BRH
Silver: JCB
Bronze: LBS

Congratulations to all the players who made this event worthwhile with their active and lively participation!

short_message: IIT Kharagpur research scholar from the Department of Biotechnology  has developed a disposable and flexible battery made from paper that could generate
message:
IIT Kharagpur research scholar from the Department of Biotechnology has developed a disposable and flexible battery made from paper that could generate power from the bacteria present in sewage water.The battery is made using air cathode, and the anode can be prepared from any simple carbon based materials.This research presented by IIT Kharagpur's' Team Electrodes' at KPIT Sparkle 2018, won the first prize and a cash award of Rs 10 lakh competing with 12,000 students from across the country. For more details have a look into the following article.
https://economictimes.ind...

short_message:
Summer internship @ India's fastest growing FinTech Startup
FinBox is a digital lending software company founded by KGP alumni looking for interns
message:
Summer internship @ India's fastest growing FinTech Startup
FinBox is a digital lending software company founded by KGP alumni looking for interns interested in Backend/ Frontend Web development and design

What does FinBox do?

FinBox enables lenders - Banks & NBFCs digitise their user journey and process applications online. We have a wide range of products such as:

Web & mobile frontend
Android SDK for capturing phone data for underwriting
Deep learning API suite for
OCR
Identity Recognition
Text parsing from unstructured data sources like SMS & Email
Big Data Products
Geospatial Data analysis
Fraud detection suite
ML based loan underwriting suite

Their stack is AWS, Django, PostGres, Tensorflow, ReactJS, Airflow with some micro services in GoLang.

Angel List Profile https://angel.co/finbox-i...

Open Positions

Junior Front End Engineer - Experience with ReactJS, HTML, CSS required. Brownie points if you can design well
Junior Back End Engineer - Experience in Python required. Familiarity with any web framework like Django or Flask would be valuable
Junior Android Engineer - Experience in android development required
Junior Data Analyst - Experience in Python required

short_message: 'This magical, marvellous food on our plate, this sustenance we absorb, has a story to tell. It has a journey. It leaves a footprint. It leaves a legacy.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos.
message:
'This magical, marvellous food on our plate, this sustenance we absorb, has a story to tell. It has a journey. It leaves a footprint. It leaves a legacy. To eat with reckless abandon, without conscience, without knowledge; folks, this ain’t normal.” In series of celebrating the 'Gratitude Month' and to remind the student community to express their gratitude to those crucial people who consistently work to make their stay at Kgp elated and gleeful, another random act of kindness was being displayed by IWG members under which they served food to mess workers along with other students in the LBS hall of residence. Entire IWG team appealed students to swell with gratitude and allow it to overwhelm and thank those workers who uninterruptedly work serving 4 meals a day, for 7 days a week.

The idea being that benefit of expressing gratitude would surely go beyond a sense of self-worth, self-efficacy, and trust between the student community and those on whom student community is dependent as gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciates the efforts made by entire IWG team to create a copacetic atmosphere in the campus.

short_message:
“However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at. All what matters is just that you don’t give up.”
Stephen Hawking
message:
“However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at. All what matters is just that you don’t give up.”
Stephen Hawking

A living embodiment of countless extraordinary traits. The Genius of the twenty first century, left us today. Dedicating his whole life to answering the biggest question humankind could impose on itself - “Where did it all begin?” and putting together the greatest theory of all times in the field - “The Big Bang theory”, he effortlessly outsmarted us all. Without a hint of pride, he made groundbreaking progress in the fields of his work. He gave us - The Brief History of Time and was most probably working on some super-intelligent theory to reveal many secrets when he finally departed to find the eternal truth behind it all.
May his soul rest in peace.

He gave us - The Brief History of Time and was most probably working on some super-intelligent theory to reveal many secrets when he finally departed to find the eternal truth behind it all.
May his soul rest in peace.

short_message: Science Education Group (SEG) in coordination with COSTISA (Coordination of Science and Technology Institutes’ Student Associations) invites you for a
message:
Science Education Group (SEG) in coordination with COSTISA (Coordination of Science and Technology Institutes’ Student Associations) invites you for a talk and discussion commemorating Shaheed Bhagat Singh.

Title: 'Bhagat Singh's Idea of Independent India'
Speaker: Prof. Jagmohan Singh (Human right activist, Nephew of Bhagat Singh and IIT Kgp Alumnus)
Date: 14th March, 2018
Time: 6PM
Venue: S. N. Bose Auditorium, IIT Kharagpur

Facebook Event: https://www.facebook.com/...

Abstract of the talk:
Shaheed Bhagat Singh - his vision of Free India and its relevance today. The talk will explore the making of Bhagat Singh in his family continuity of four generation of dedication to socio-political cause of people. There will be touching the development of Bhagat Singh's response to various social , economic and political problems of the time. How he analyzed and expressed himself on various contemporary movements. An in depth attempt will be understand how he prepared himself to be able to challenge the British Imperial rule and at the same time played a role of 'a vanguard of the broad national movement.' We will be understanding his practical approach in establishing youth movement which not only challenged the social basis but established a culture of freedom living. This will all based on his own writings and family information.

'Great are great because we are on our knees, let us arise. '

About the Speaker:
Prof. Jagmohan Singh, former Professor at Punjab Agriculture University, Ludhiana, an alumnus of IIT Kharagpur, has been committed to dissemination of Bhagat Singh’s ideas. Son of Bhagat Singh’s sister Bibi Amar Kaur, Professor Jagmohan Singh has digitized most of the essential writings of Bhagat Singh. He is also the founding member of the Association For Democratic Rights (Punjab), the Jamhuri Adhikar Sabha which was formed in 1978. The association was conceived as a mass-based group to carry out a firsthand investigation of the reports of violation of human rights and put it in the public domain to help people’s movements in the fight for justice.

short_message: Oil is often a prized possession for countries. They believe it will bring in a secure source of income. However, countries that are major oil exporters
message: Oil is often a prized possession for countries. They believe it will bring in a secure source of income. However, countries that are major oil exporters may face problems on other fronts. There is a tendency for high oil prices leading to lesser political freedom. Read this article, written by two of our very own members, to know more about this effect and what it means for countries.

short_message: Finance Buddha is looking for summer interns who are interested in building scalable applications which involves business analytics, cutting edge tech
message:
Finance Buddha is looking for summer interns who are interested in building scalable applications which involves business analytics, cutting edge tech & machine learning.

Apply if you qualify for the below requirements:

1) Studying in any Elite College (IIT/NIT/BITS) can apply.
2) Should have prior web/mobile app development experience.
3) Mandatory Technologies Required: HTML5/CSS3/JS/JQuery/PHP (MVC).
4) Knowledge of NodeJS/Webpack/Gulp/Angular/React & Express/CodeIgniter/Laravel is a plus.

Interns who performed well can get a chance to work in Finance Buddha (Pre-Placement Offer) and a internship certificate.

Interest candidates can share your resume at puja@ financebuddha.com

short_message:
Finals || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Volleyball

RK vs MMM1 (3-2): In the jam-packed Volleyball court, the final match
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Naidu Nani and 9 others.
message:
Finals || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Volleyball

RK vs MMM1 (3-2): In the jam-packed Volleyball court, the final match was played between MMM1 and RK. RK dominated the first set, winning it by 25-14. But MMM1 was in no mood to bow down and made a great comeback by winning consecutive sets by 25-18, 27-25 respectively. RK bounced back in the game and won the 4th set by 25-22, setting up the final for an exciting finish. Both the teams fought with full energy but it was RK who came on top, winning the decider set by 15-9 and finally the match by 25-14, 18-25, 25-27, 25-22, 15-9.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the teams for putting up a brilliant show and the winning team for becoming the champions!

short_message: Most of us have had a teenage fantasy for machines, vehicles and technology, but hardly anyone fuels his fantasies in a way that Mr. Siddartha Khastgir,
message:
Most of us have had a teenage fantasy for machines, vehicles and technology, but hardly anyone fuels his fantasies in a way that Mr. Siddartha Khastgir, a KGP graduate who is now a globally recognized researcher, has done!
In this article of our series “Jewels of KGP”, we are delighted to present before you this young talent who transformed his boyhood love for hot wheels and formula one racing into building autonomous cars! While he was an undergraduate student of Mechanical Engineering in KGP, Siddartha took a giant leap for his passion of cars as he procured a funding of 1 Million from Sponsored Research and Industrial Consultancy (SRIC), IIT KGP and founded Team KART-Formula SAE Team of IIT Kharagpur in his third year of engineering.
He currently pursues research at the University of Warwick in autonomous vehicles. Recently, he has also been named in the prestigious Forbes 30 Under 30 Europe 2018- Industry List for research contributions which have delivered impact to the automotive industry.
Awaaz got a chance to interact with Siddartha and this conversation gives a glimpse into the professional and personal life of this realistic optimist who has never believed in giving up!
http://awaaziitkgp.org/si...

message:
Hey everyone, thanks for coming for any of the quizzes that you came to till now. If you haven't and even if you have, please come for the final two quizzes of the Quiz Week today from 1:30 PM on Sunday to beat the heat.
We promise it is going to be interesting like all the quizzes till now.
Sourav Kundu and Abhimanyu Bharade are setting the Sci-Tech quiz set to start by 1:30 PM and then you have one of the most awaited quizzes of the Quiz Week, the Pop-Culture Quiz, which has been set by Hemansh Kashyap and Mayank Roy from 7:30 PM in V3.

See you there and bring all of your friends along too!

P.S: Bring Your Own Pens

short_message:
IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post.

General Quiz and Biz Quiz | Quiz Week Day 5

Day 5 saw a very busy
story: IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post.
message:
IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post.

General Quiz and Biz Quiz | Quiz Week Day 5

Day 5 saw a very busy day with quizzes after quizzes going on at Vikramshila. General Quiz started early in the afternoon with people gathering being treated with a dose of everything in the world. After that, the Biz Quiz took place in the evening and saw a very topsy-turvy finale with the final spots getting chosen in the final few questions.

Results:
General Quiz:
First: Amit Kumar Ram, Agnimitra Anand, Pranav Joshi (260)
Second: Piyush Kedia, Rupam Kumar Dubey, Vaibhav Krishna (210)
Third: Kaustav Mandal, Kaniska Ghosh + 1 (205)

Biz Quiz:
First: Piyush Kedia, Kaustav Mandal, Anmol Joshi (270)
Second: Sourav Chirania, Harsha Vattem, Siddhant Ladha (240)
Third: Amit Kumar Ram, Anurag Mondal, Shubhra Agrawal (230)

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates all the winners and wishes IIT KGP Quiz Club best of luck for the last day of the Quiz Week tomorrow.

message:
Semi-Finals || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Volleyball

Semi-Final 1: MMM1 vs LBS
The match was very interesting. Both teams played well but it was MMM who got better of LBS defeating them in 3 straight sets. The scores read:
Set 1: MMM - 25, LBS - 19
Set 2: MMM - 25, LBS - 20
Set 3: MMM - 25, LBS - 21
With this win, MMM advances to the finals.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team!

Enactus
The Largest Community Of Students Across
story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Enactus IIT Kharagpur's post.
message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Enactus IIT Kharagpur's post.

Enactus
The Largest Community Of Students Across The Globe Making The World A Better Place Through Social Entrepreneurship.

In Enactus we believe that every individual has the ability to make impact in their community - not in the form of charity - but by using the positive power of business.

Participation in Enactus provides you the opportunity to make a meaningful difference in their communities, while gaining the experience, skills and contacts necessary to build a successful career.

Enactus IIT Kharagpur invite you to be a part of the change.
Be a part of us. Register Now: http://bit.do/enactusiitk...
Deadline of application- 11th March 2018 till midnight
To know more : http://enactus.org /

#WeAllWin #Enactus

Day 4 saw a lot of the MELA enthusiasts
story: IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post.
message:
IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post.

MELA Quiz | Quiz Week Day 4

Day 4 saw a lot of the MELA enthusiasts in the campus turn up for the quiz which turned out to be a very entertaining, exciting and close affair right down till the last question when the podium was finally decided.
This time around, all the participants who qualified from the prelims stayed back to sit for the finals and made the event a success.

First: Agnimitra Anand, Kaniska Ghosh, Mayank Roy
Second: R. Srihari, Anurag Kar, Prachurjya Biswas
Third: Mohit Tulsyan, Nikhil Nayan Jha, Varun PD

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners and the QMs on an exciting quiz and wishes IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club the best of luck for the four quizzes to be held in the next two days.

short_message:
Hola First Years!
Do you wish to have an insight on how International Relations Cell contributes in improving the global ranking of IIT Kharagpur?
message:
Hola First Years!
Do you wish to have an insight on how International Relations Cell contributes in improving the global ranking of IIT Kharagpur?
Here lies the opportunity.
Register at http://bit.ly/IRCELL2018
International Relations Cell IIT Kharagpur opens its doors for the first years to be a “Theme for our Team”. Through this selection, we provide first years the opportunities to solve a number of intensive case studies and analyze various programs that could benefit IIT Kgp at the global level.
Like Audrey Hepburn always says “Opportunities don’t often come along. So when they do, you have to grab them.”
So grab a motive and be there!
Well, we are not done yet. We are also selecting the design team and web team members. So all the interested newbies do come!

short_message: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur brings to you the digital format of the February newsletter which contains a detailed report on the problems pertaining to the B C
message:
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur brings to you the digital format of the February newsletter which contains a detailed report on the problems pertaining to the B C Roy Technology Hospital, the survey report on the need for Basic Amenities at different places of the campus along with regular columns like Jewels of KGP, Humans of KGP. Don't miss out on the Panji Dude and Cartoon Kona, Bhaat and the editorial on Aadhar.
Suggestions and feedbacks are always welcome that help us grow from strength to strength and address the grievances of the student community as an active media body.
https://issuu.com/awaaz/d...

short_message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Sports & Games || Lawn Tennis

LLR vs AZ
AZ won by 2-1
Aman Gupta (AZ) lost to Shashank Jaipuria (LLR)
message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Sports & Games || Lawn Tennis

LLR vs AZ
AZ won by 2-1
Aman Gupta (AZ) lost to Shashank Jaipuria (LLR) by 5-8.
Kunaal Punj and Nishant Kumar (AZ) beat Shashank Jaipuria and Shashi Kant (LLR) by 8-1.
Nishant Kumar (AZ) beat Shashi Kant (LLR) by 8-0.

RK vs BRH
RK won by 2-0
Kunal Pattanayak (RK) beat Naseeb Gill (BRH) by 7-1.
Kunal Pattanayak and Shailesh Mishra (RK) beat Naseeb Gill and partner (BRH) by 7-0.

Patel vs Nehru
Patel won by 2-0.
Ankit Pardeshi (Patel) beat Anvesh (Nehru) by 8-2.
Ankit and Ayush (Patel) beat Rahul and Anvesh (Nehru) by 8-1.

MMM vs LLR
MMM won by 2-0.
Sauramya Pandeya (MMM) beat Shashank Jaipuria (LLR) by 8-0.
Sauramya and Anshuman (MMM) beat Shashank and Chetan (LLR) by 6-1.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams!

short_message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur's post.

If you go on a 2.2 tonight and find
story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur's post.

If you go on a 2.2 tonight and find some flocks of paper notes around, just go ahead give them a glance!
Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur has today organised a flash gratitude expression drive at various locations of the Scholars' Avenue which saw an overwhelming response!
More than 600 students, faculty, even security and rickshaw pullers came forward to write interesting thank you notes expressing gratitude the most subtle elements/people in their lives!
If you didn't get to write it this time, don't mind, its not going to be flash next time! We'll be back with the same act within a fortnight!
#GratitudeMonth #ThankYouKGP #IWG

short_message:
IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post.

Women's Quiz | Quiz Week Day 3

Day 3, a veritable first for KGP
story: IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post.
message:
IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post.

Women's Quiz | Quiz Week Day 3

Day 3, a veritable first for KGP quizzing in many ways saw a women-only quiz being conducted with 25 participants, which, compared to the norm of 2-3 women in regular quizzes was a huge improvement. It continued the trend of first-timers leaving right after prelims without waiting for the results for yet another day in a row where the third member of the (later on)first place team left, assuming she wouldn't qualify. Considering that almost all of the participants being first-time quizzers, the scores received in the prelims and finals results were very competitive.
The aim of the event had been to try and introduce women to the sport and the response, especially in the finals from teams was very positive, with blocks and enthusiastic hint requests and clarifications going around on questions. The finals boiled down to a tie-breaker for third place and after three further tie-breaker questions which couldn't break the tie, the third place remained tied till the end in the final result.
Prof. Seema Singh of the HSS department also graced the event with her presence and stayed almost till the end of the quiz.

First: Sangeeta Roy, Shubhra Agrawal (225)
Second: Ayushi Mrigen, Nikita Gautam, Kavana Rao (135)
Third: Shubhi Jain, Abhigna Revuru, Nayan Kubade (130) and
Pankhuri Saxena, Samruddhi Pataskar and Pankhudi Jain (130)
Fourth: (125)
Fifth: (120)

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners and hopes that this helps somewhat bridge the gender disparity in quizzing in the campus and further wishes IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club best of luck for the future quizzes in this event.

short_message: 'There's something so special about a woman who dominates in a man's world. It takes a certain grace, strength, intelligence, fearlessness, and the nerve
story: AIESEC India added 4 new photos.
message:
'There's something so special about a woman who dominates in a man's world. It takes a certain grace, strength, intelligence, fearlessness, and the nerve to never take no for an answer.' - Unknown

Today as we celebrate the #InternationalWomensDay, we are glad to be a part of a community where we are surrounded by women who are giving us reasons to celebrate leadership everyday. Here's to all the brave, strong and courageous women out there that raise and fought through the time and emerged as leading forces for the society. We hope that this fire continues to burn like never before.

short_message: This Women's Day, let's talk about one of the recent initiatives taken by a group of girls who came together and founded the IIT Kharagpur chapter of Lean
message:
This Women's Day, let's talk about one of the recent initiatives taken by a group of girls who came together and founded the IIT Kharagpur chapter of Lean In i.e., Lean In, IIT Kharagpur! They are a group of peers who meet weekly to share personal experiences, discuss weekly goals and provide professional support in a place of confidentiality and trust. They talk openly about their ambitions and encourage each other to take on new challenges. At a place like IIT Kharagpur, the skewed gender ratio results in a number of biases. By bringing a discussion about these biases, they want to help people, both men and women to fight against them.
Lean In Foundation is a nonprofit organization founded by Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg in 2013 following the success of her book titled Lean In. The foundation is dedicated to offering women the ongoing inspiration and support to help them achieve their goals. Inspired by the success of other circles around the globe, they started a Lean In circle at IIT Kharagpur.
Give this a read: http://awaaziitkgp.org/le...

short_message: 'Woman' is the culmination of all human abstracts. Her innocence can be felt in the form of a daughter, her care as a sister, warmth in form of a friend,
message:
'Woman' is the culmination of all human abstracts. Her innocence can be felt in the form of a daughter, her care as a sister, warmth in form of a friend, passion in form of a beloved, her dedication as a wife, her divinity in form of a mother, her blessings in form of a grandmother. She is a complete circle who has the power to create, nurture and transform.
The entire Awaaz family wishes all a very Happy International Women’s Day!

short_message:
IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post.

India Quiz | Quiz Week: Day 2

Day 2 in the Intra-KGP Quiz Week
story: IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post.
message:
IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post.

India Quiz | Quiz Week: Day 2

Day 2 in the Intra-KGP Quiz Week saw an even higher participation from the KGP population, with similar scenes occurring with first timers as day one. Another prelims participant had to miss out because of low self-confidence about his own talent because he left for his hall without leaving any contact info.
Both the prelims and finals were highly entertaining, with all the three podium places getting cleared out in the final three questions of the quiz with all the other teams chasing just 5-15 points behind.
The point of female participation came up again today, but this time, there was some participation from the female populace and one of them even making it to the finals.

First: Harsh Agarwal, Pinaki Mishra, Sourav Kundu (180)
Second: Sourav Chirania, Baibhab Pattnaik, Kaniska Ghosh (150)
Third: Satyam Agarwal, Pratik Gokul Zaware, Shreyans Sadangi (145)
Fourth, Fifth, Sixth: (140)

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners and wishes IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club all the best for today's Women Only Quiz.

short_message: Yet another proud moment for KGPians! Shri Vinay Kumar (IFS: 1992), an IIT KGP alumnus, has been appointed as India’s new ambassador to the Islamic Republic
message:
Yet another proud moment for KGPians! Shri Vinay Kumar (IFS: 1992), an IIT KGP alumnus, has been appointed as India’s new ambassador to the Islamic Republic Of Afghanistan. He is currently serving as Joint Secretary at the Ministry Of External Affairs in New Delhi and is expected to take up his assignment shortly. As said by the ministry, he has held various positions, including an assignment in India’s permanent mission to the United Nations.

On the behalf of entire KGP community, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes him all the best for his tenure!

Source- http://mea.gov.in/press-r...

short_message:
S-Set sail on an international adventure
E-Escalate your technical and cultural skills
P-Perceive the best opportunity
message:
S-Set sail on an international adventure
E-Escalate your technical and cultural skills
P-Perceive the best opportunity of a lifetime

IR cell is proud to announce the first of its kind initiative in the history of IIT Kgp, the commencement of the Reciprocal Student Exchange Program. Years of continued efforts are now resulting in unique collaborations between IIT Kgp and global institutions on mutual exchange of value basis. We are elated to announce the first such collaboration with the Leibniz University of Hanover, Germany. Applications are now open for 4 opportunities under the program with tuition fee waiver and free accommodation at the host university. We believe this is a great start and encourage every student to explore SEP. Please follow the prescribed application procedure under SAP on our website: international.iitkgp.ac.in

We believe in growing by increasing exposure to the students and hope this will open a plethora of options in the future. We assure you many great collaborations in the near future!!

short_message:
IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post.

Sports Quiz | Quiz Week : Day 1

Today saw the participation of
story: IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post.
message:
IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post.

Sports Quiz | Quiz Week : Day 1

Today saw the participation of close to 70 people for the prelims and we saw the greatest fear of most non-quizzers coming up in action and tackled head-on.
Two people out of the 24 finalists scored higher than Quiz Club regulars and yet, because they thought they hadn't done well enough, left without even waiting for the results. One of them didn't submit their contact details so we couldn't even reach them to let them know and hence had to take the next highest scorer present. We later got to know that there were two-three people who didn't want to see if they could qualify and didn't submit their answer sheet for checking, where it turned out that they would've actually qualified for the finals. The team that won actually had a member like that, who after giving up, decided to go to his room, from where he had to be called to come back for the finals and eventually won. The finals itself was a cliffhanger with the podium places getting decided in the last two questions of the quiz.

Furthermore, there were no women in attendance. An event, that has no barriers to entry, and no prerequisites for taking part, as well as cash prizes and refreshments where non-regulars to QC sessions turned up and performed very well had an entire section of our campus population giving it a miss in participation definitely speaks volumes about this. We invite discussion regarding this in the comments section, and more than discussion, ideas to improve this situation, considering that Quiz Club has brought laurels for the institute in multiple places throughout the past years and their current Quiz Week initiative is an attempt to lure in people who don't consider themselves knowledgeable enough.

Final Results:

First: B. Pattnaik, Bhart Singh, Sougata Paul (135)
Second: Agnimitra Anand, Piyush Kedia, Hemansh Kashyap (120)
Third: Amit Kumar Ram, Rajat Jain, Kaushal Vadera (118)
Fourth Place: (115)

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners and wishes Quiz Club all the best for the rest of the quizzes to be held as part of Quiz Week.

Furthermore, there were no women in attendance. An event, that has no barriers to entry, and no prerequisites for taking part, as well as cash prizes and refreshments where non-regulars to QC sessions turned up and performed very well had an entire section of our campus population giving it a miss in participation definitely speaks volumes about this. We invite discussion regarding this in the comments section, and more than discussion, ideas to improve this situation, considering that Quiz Club has brought laurels for the institute in multiple places throughout the past years and their current Quiz Week initiative is an attempt to lure in people who don't consider themselves knowledgeable enough.

Final Results:

First: B. Pattnaik, Bhart Singh, Sougata Paul (135)
Second: Agnimitra Anand, Piyush Kedia, Hemansh Kashyap (120)
Third: Amit Kumar Ram, Rajat Jain, Kaushal Vadera (118)
Fourth Place: (115)

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners and wishes Quiz Club all the best for the rest of the quizzes to be held as part of Quiz Week.

message:
The schedule for Gyandhara, the quizzing festival of IIEST Shibpur, organized by Quizmaniac BEings, the official quizzing club of IIEST Shibpur is going to be organised from 30th March to 1st April.
Being a national holiday on both Thursday and Friday, it's a long weekend and we are providing free accommodation to outstation participants.
Like and follow our page Gyandhara for more details.
Happy Quizzing.

short_message:
25,000 likes!
A journey that started way back in 2006 with a monthly newsletter has now evolved into a full-fledged media body working day and night
message:
25,000 likes!
A journey that started way back in 2006 with a monthly newsletter has now evolved into a full-fledged media body working day and night to keep the campus aware and involved.

It is the unswerving trust of the KGP community that infuses belief in us and powers us to present all the latest happenings, academic information and administrative updates. Your relentless support, at times in the form of positive criticism, helps us raise daily-life issues faced by the students which in turn plays a vital role in many in-campus reforms.

Sticking to our ideals of unbiased, authentic and fearless journalism, Awaaz hopes to keep its tireless determination to serve intact and continue scaling new statistical and journalistic heights.

With the following lyrical rhythm reflecting all your love and faith, Awaaz thanks all of you for your continuous support.

राह को मंज़िल से लड़ना अच्छा लगता है।
कल तक जो किनारा नज़र आता था,
आज मील का पत्थर है।
कितनी ही कहानियों की कश्ती
किस्सों का चप्पू थामें,
हमें इतनी आगे लें आईं हैं,
कि यादें अब सुनहरा साहिल सा प्रतीत होतीं हैं।
अब भी उतार चढ़ाव की लहरें गुफ्तुगू
करती हैं हमसे,
लब खामोश रहने के लिए नहीं होते।
एक कलम क़ायनात तो नहीं
हालात ज़रूर लिख सकती है,
लिखा हुआ तो बदलता नहीं,
पर हालात ज़रूर बदलते हैं।
लिख कर चीखो
या बोल कर,
पर खामोश रहना
सबसे खतरनाक होता है।
सबसे ख़तरनाक होता है
मुर्दा शांति से भर जाना
तड़प का न होना
सब कुछ सहन कर जाना।
आवाज़ तुम में हैं
आवाज़ मुझमें हैं,
बस लगाने की देरी है।

short_message:
'When you brand yourself properly, the competition becomes irrelevant'.
The importance of branding is as important as the brand itself.
Branding
message:
'When you brand yourself properly, the competition becomes irrelevant'.
The importance of branding is as important as the brand itself.
Branding And Relations Cell since its inception has taken initiatives to position IIT Kharagpur as a global brand. We welcome you all to our introductory seminar, to get an insight into the working of the official public relations cell of IIT Kharagpur.

Also to make community outside IIT Kharagpur aware about the achievements of various students inside the campus, we will be launching the 'Students' Speak' blog on the same day.

Date: 8th March
Time: 7:30 pm
Venue: V2, Vikramshila

short_message: Opportunities are like sunrises, if you wait too long, you’ll miss them. And with opportunities come new beginnings to embrace. Another such opportunity
message:
Opportunities are like sunrises, if you wait too long, you’ll miss them. And with opportunities come new beginnings to embrace. Another such opportunity is in front of you, to become a part of one of the most active entrepreneurship promoting bodies of India. Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur is hiring First Year Students to be a part of the core team. Come and join us in a series of exciting activities that we have planned as a part of the screening process!

Date - 7th and 8th March 2018
Venue - STEP (Opp. SBI Bank)
Register at - ecell-iitkgp.org/am2018

short_message: IIT Kharagpur is set to host the two-day 'INAE Youth Conclave' from March 23, aiming to engage budding engineers from different disciplines. The main objective
message:
IIT Kharagpur is set to host the two-day 'INAE Youth Conclave' from March 23, aiming to engage budding engineers from different disciplines. The main objective of the INAE is to provide a forum for our youth to manifest their budding talents and entrepreneurship zeal for improving the lives of common people.
Have a look at the following article published in Business Standard to know more regarding INAE Youth conclave.
http://www.business-stand...

short_message: 5th edition of Kharagpur Open Tennis was organised at IIT Kharagpur on 3rd and 4th March. The event saw participation from different corners of West Bengal
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 41 new photos — with William Mohanty and 4 others.
message:
5th edition of Kharagpur Open Tennis was organised at IIT Kharagpur on 3rd and 4th March. The event saw participation from different corners of West Bengal competing for the top honours and results were as follow:
* Open Singles *
Winner: Kunaal Punj
Runner-up: Anurag V.V.
Semi-finalists: Kunal Pattanayak
Prathamesh Chavan

* Open Doubles *
Winner: Souramya Pandya & Anurag V.V.
Runner-up: Kunaal Punj & Akhil Andasu
Semi-finalists: Prof. Rajendra Singh & Mr. Vivek Pandey
Kunal Pattanayak & Prathamesh Chavan

*Women's category*
Matches were not held due to lack of sufficient number of girl participants.

* Veteran Singles *
Winner: Mr. Sudipta Datta
Runner-up: Mr. Gailey
Semi-finalists: Mr. S. Bakshi

* Veteran Doubles *
Winner: Prof. Rajendra Singh & Dr. Prabhakaran
Runner-up: Mr. Gailey & Mr. Gurung
Semi-finalists: Mr. S. Bakshi & Mr. Kannan
Mr. Sudipta Dutta & Mr. Anjan Bhattacharya

Presentation ceremony saw the presence of dignitaries including Prof. S. K. Bhattacharya (Deputy Director), Prof. Bhrigu Nath Singh (Dean, HR), Dr. M. B. Dey (Special guest), Prof. William Mohanty (President, TSG) and Prof. Rajendra Singh. Deputy Director sir emphasised on the sportsman spirit and importance of sports in our student life. Winning isn't everything. We need to move forward and keep trying. He thanked players for participating in this competition. Prof. B. N. Singh lauded the efforts of organising committee and participants. When people are on the field, they forget everything and only think about winning. he also congratulated the winners. President, Technology Students' Gymkhana, Prof. William Mohanty explained about the overhauling of infrastructure and said that there are more tennis courses coming up which will improve the scenario.

short_message: With a participation of more than 1500 students and professionals across the country, along with a exemplar lineup of more than 25 inspiring entrepreneurs
message:
With a participation of more than 1500 students and professionals across the country, along with a exemplar lineup of more than 25 inspiring entrepreneurs and corporates, GES 2018 was a huge success in terms of the impact created on the Student Startup Ecosystem. Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur, along with Juneja'S Film & photography, brings to you the Official After Movie of the entire summit, to sum up all the events and competitions that took place in those 3 days!
#GES2k18
#Aftermovie

ZS associates in collaboration with Business Club brings
story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Business Club, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message:
The Scholars' Avenue shared Business Club, IIT Kharagpur's post.

Greetings!
ZS associates in collaboration with Business Club brings to you an open house session -“Brown Bag on the Art and Science of Problem-Solving”. It will focus on understanding the most effective approaches of solving a case study. This session will also act as an introduction to the case study competition to be organized by ZS, winners of which will get Pre-Placement Interview (PPI) offers from ZS! What to wait for? Embark on the journey of honing your skills and begin your expedition into the fascinating world of consulting that might just hold your future. We have exciting goodies and refreshments that await your presence. This session is exclusively for pre-final year students. Since limited number of seats are available, register at: https://tinyurl.com/y989q...

7 PM, 6th March | V4
For any queries please contact:
Puneet: 9783611967
Aman: 7430011888

short_message: Inter Hall Gardening Competition was held on 4th March 2018 (Sunday) where all the participating Halls came up with unique ideas and themes. All the participating
message:
Inter Hall Gardening Competition was held on 4th March 2018 (Sunday) where all the participating Halls came up with unique ideas and themes. All the participating Halls showed great zeal and enthusiasm and with the help of staffs, they succeeded in conveying the various messages that were intended for all of us!

Results are as follow:
Gold - Azad Hall - Save girl child and women empowerment
Silver - MMM Hall - Monumental structures of IIT KGP and Konark temple wheel
Bronze - Nehru Hall - Devotional things including Maa Kali and Swastika sign
Consolation Prize - JCB Hall - Conserve water and save the earth

We are very much thankful to our esteemed judges who took some time out of their busy schedule to judge the competition. Jury panel consisted of Mrs. Kajal Bhattacharya, Mrs. Sagarika Dasgupta and Mrs. Preeti Padma Das. They played an important role by minutely observing each and every garden and came out with unanimous decision.

We would like to thank all the students and staff members who came up with brilliant ideas to be conveyed through flowers!

short_message: In this era of entrepreneurship and startups, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur sees it as its responsibility to share some of the successful startup stories. Here
message:
In this era of entrepreneurship and startups, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur sees it as its responsibility to share some of the successful startup stories. Here we present to you the story of Mr. Praveen Wadalkar, Co-Founder and CEO of Techizer Tech Solution Pvt. Ltd. ( www.techizerindia.com ), a highly specialized Pharma Digital Marketing firm that focuses on leveraging technology to build strong pharmaceutical brands. We got a chance to interact with him during the Global Entrepreneurship Summit organised by the Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur last month. By passion, Mr. Wadalkar is a motivational speaker, Business storyteller, and corporate trainer. Aside from having delivered 2 TEDx talks he is also ranked among top 10 competitive public speakers in international speech contest 2017 at District 98 by Toastmasters International.

He started his career in Cipla in 2001. As a marketing specialist, he was involved in brand building and strategy development. Progressively he went on to head the marketing function at Mylan Pharma. A US-based pharmaceutical organization. After 10 years of Specialized work in the pharmaceutical sector, he started his own IT firm Techizer which today employing around 75 employees and providing strategic IT solutions to more than 100 pharmaceutical companies in Asia.

short_message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur in association with the Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB) organized a bilateral cricket series that featured
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 19 new photos — with William Mohanty and Somesh Kumar.
message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur in association with the Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB) organized a bilateral cricket series that featured two 3-day matches between Bangladesh U-15 and Bengal U-15 cricket teams in the Tata Sports Complex during 19– 25 February 2018.
The results were as follow:
MATCH: 1st three-day match between CAB U15 & BCB U-15
Date: 19-21 February 2018
Toss: CAB U15
Result: Match drawn

CAB U15 1st innings 240 all out in 57.1 overs (Taufiquddin Mandal 174; Azizul Hakim Rony 16.1-2-41-5 and Mahfuzur Rahman Rabby 14-03-45-4)

BCB U15 1st Innings 401 all out in 108.5 overs (Aich Mollah 78, ASM Zulkar Nayeem 75, Sazzad Hossain Miraj 58 runs; Jayesh KR Singh 11-1-34-2, Prince KR Singh 13.5-02-42-2)

CAB U15 2nd innings 266 for 7 in 91 overs (Abhishek Porel 61, Mushtaq Ahmed Mondol 51, Taufiquddin Mandal 50; Mahfuzur Rahman Rabby 28-11-60-4)

MATCH: 2nd three-day match between CAB U15 & BCB U-15
Date: 23-25 February 2018
Toss: CAB U15
Result: Match Drawn

CAB U15 1st innings 191 all out in 76.1 overs (Mustaq Ahmed Mandal 32; Mahfuzur Rahman Rabby 23.1-13-27-05, Aich Mollah 08-04-11-2)

BCB U15 1st Innings 226 all out in 100.3 overs (ASM Zulkar Nayeen 57; Siddhaeth Singh 26-07-46-3)

CAB U15 2nd innings 249/9 in 77 overs (Abihishek Porel 107*; Mahfuzur Rahman Rabby 29-09-54-5)

The series also witnessed the presence of Mr. Avishek Dalmiya, Joint Secretary, Cricket Association of Bengal, Mr. Pranab Roy, Former Cricketer of Team India and Mr. Dipu Roy Chaudhury, Former Cricketer of Bangladesh.

Picture Credits: Prof. William Mohanty

short_message:
IIT Kharagpur to boost Artificial Intelligence education supported by Capillary Technologies

Whether it is explicitly acknowledged or not, in
message:
IIT Kharagpur to boost Artificial Intelligence education supported by Capillary Technologies

Whether it is explicitly acknowledged or not, in this era of technology, AI has been an effective tool, bridging the gap between data scientists, lawyers, sociologists, and economists studying its implementation. After developing a deep expertise in the area of Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Sciences and its applications in several critical domains over a long period of time, IIT KGP has again set a benchmark by setting up a first of its own kind Center of Excellence in Artificial Intelligence Research covering education, training, research, projects, incubation and entrepreneurship in AI and related domains to fulfill the need of AI technologies. The Center, which will be seed funded by Capillary Technologies Limited, for an amount Rs. 5.64 crore for setting up computing infrastructure, hardware simulation platforms, software and designing the coursework, would be started with teaching and learning and knowledge dissemination program.
The curriculum will include short-term credit courses and certificate program for internal and external students along with industrial training programs. For further information, one can visit the following link:

https://indiaeducationdia...

short_message:
(defun Codefest()
(terpri)

(princ 'On March 1, 1960, the first LISP Programmer's Manual was released. Considered the mother tongue of Artificial
message:
(defun Codefest()
(terpri)

(princ 'On March 1, 1960, the first LISP Programmer's Manual was released. Considered the mother tongue of Artificial Intelligence (AI), LISP is older than most other high-level languages still in use today. Created by John McCarthy, LISP became the first language to include recursion and conditional expressions. LISP is an example of a functional programming language, just as C++ and Java are examples of object-oriented languages.
What does LISP offer you?
Long story short: LISP offers you a stunning level of productivity which frees you to write complex, robust, understandable and evolving applications with an order-of-magnitude reduction in the associated pain.
Codefest'18 celebrates the development of LISP and how without it, basic operations such as recursion, and the wonderful applications of AI would have been impossible.'
)

(#Codefest)

short_message: One and half year ago, an RTI filed to the MHRD had revealed that the annual electric bill paid by IIT Kharagpur to the Ministry of Energy & Power Distribution,
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 7 new photos.
message:
One and half year ago, an RTI filed to the MHRD had revealed that the annual electric bill paid by IIT Kharagpur to the Ministry of Energy & Power Distribution, Govt. of West Bengal, has surged steeply from Rupees 16 crores 18 lakhs in 2011 to an almost double of 31 crores 46 lakhs in 2016. And this figure has been relentlessly increasing day by day. While most of this surge can be attributed to the increased infrastructure in this period, misuse and wastage of electricity also play a pivotal role in this colossal figure. Many time, we are seen to leave the lights and fans running while we go to the class; not because of our unwillingness but because of our carelessness.
And guess what? It's our irresponsibleness that's been adding to the expenditure and consumption figure day by day. For the last couple of months, our reporters have been observing the common habits that we KGPians have when it comes to using electrical appliances. What we've found is that there has been a huge insensitiveness towards the wastage of electricity. Many lights and fans remain on even when there is absolutely no need of that. While most of this has been observed in the Academic Complex and Halls of Residences, it has been seen in various Departments, street lights on roads etc. Even if we see it happening right in front of us, we either simply don't care or it seems too demanding for us to get that fixed. This completely reflects the fact that we, as a community, have failed to deliver on the responsibilities.
We should never forget that there are still more than 150 million people in our country who do not know how does it feel to spend nights with lights! All it needs is a small initiative from your side and all you have to do is to switch a button off or find the concerned person (in case of street lights) and get it switched off. We, from Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urge each one of us to use the electricity judiciously and encourage our friends towards the same. After all, each and every small contribution counts!

short_message: Hall Management Centre (HMC) has recently issued a notice urging the students to remove Air Conditioners (ACs) and other high power consuming appliances
message: Hall Management Centre (HMC) has recently issued a notice urging the students to remove Air Conditioners (ACs) and other high power consuming appliances that have been installed without seeking any permission from the authorities by 7th of March. While it is illegal to install such appliances without necessary approvals, the electrical lines have not been designed for such heavy loads which in turn endangers the safety of the students.

short_message: Quiz Club, IIT Kharagpur has had a very active year and we believe that all the students apart from the active people in the meetings should also
story: IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club added an event.
message:
Quiz Club, IIT Kharagpur has had a very active year and we believe that all the students apart from the active people in the meetings should also have a chance at exploring their latent talent in this mindsport.
With this aim in mind, we bring to you 8 Quizzes over the course of 6 days from 6th March to 11th March.
All the quizzes will have assured prize money for the podium finishers and they will happen in a format that gives every person a good chance of entering the finals with a strong team.

Eligibility: Currently Studying Student in IIT Kharagpur
Prelims: SOLO, and top 24 advance to the finals
Finals: Top 24 are paired up together with Teams being formed in the following fashion:
1,24,9 is Team 1; 2,23,10 is Team 2 and so on till the 8 teams are formed.

The Quiz Topics are as follows:

Sports Quiz (6th March)
India Quiz (7th March)
Women's Quiz (Women Only) (8th March, on the occasion of International Women's Day)
MELA (Music, Entertainment, Literature, Arts) Quiz (9th March)
Sci-Tech Quiz (10th March, afternoon slot)
Biz Quiz (10th March, night slot)
General Quiz (11th March afternoon slot)
Pop Culture Quiz (11th March, night slot)
Date: 07:30PM
Time: 06-03-2018
Veunu: Vikramshila, IIT Kharagpur

short_message: It comes as no surprise that one of the KGP teams have won the national level analytics challenge conducted by EXL. The team of Sanskar Rawat and Shreshth
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Sanskar Rawat and Shreshth Khare.
message:
It comes as no surprise that one of the KGP teams have won the national level analytics challenge conducted by EXL. The team of Sanskar Rawat and Shreshth Khare showcased their analytical skills to outperform all the other teams and grab the winner's trophy. EXL Excellence Quotient 2018 was an Analytics-cum-Business case challenge in which teams were asked to redesign the mall and optimize its layout earning more revenue to the owners. The competition was open to 20 premier academic institutes across the country including 8 IITs and 7 NITs. A total of 680 teams registered out of which 63 qualified through 1st Round and only 6 teams made it through the 2nd Round to the National Finals. The teams were invited to present the case at Gurgaon on 26th February 2018. Team INSIDIOUS from IIT Kharagpur secured the 1st position thereby bringing laurels to the institute and stamping their authority at national level.
Both team members find this field of business analytics very alluring. The winning team also pocketed a cash prize of Rs.1,00,000 along with certificates and a winning trophy.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners!

short_message: Heartiest congratulations to Mr. Shreshth Khare and Mr. Sanskar Rawat, third-year undergraduates of the Department of Chemical Engineering for winning
message:
Heartiest congratulations to Mr. Shreshth Khare and Mr. Sanskar Rawat, third-year undergraduates of the Department of Chemical Engineering for winning the 8th edition of EXL Excellence Quotient (EQ) data case challenge. The competition is held across 20 top engineering institutes including 8 IITs and 7 NITs. A total of 680 teams registered for the competition and after two stages of submissions, top 6 teams were invited to present their case in the National Finals at EXL Head Office, Gurgaon. Ms. Anjali Bharti and Mr. Anshul Gupta from IIT Kharagpur working under the Team title 'Panacea ' also secured their position in the National finals.

The winning team, Team Insidious from IIT Kharagpur received a cash prize of Rs. 1 Lakh along with certificates and winning trophy. Pre-placement interview offer was extended to all the 6 teams who made it to the National Finals.

message:

The competition is held across 20 top engineering institutes including 8 IITs and 7 NITs. A total of 680 teams registered for the competition and after two stages of submissions, top 6 teams were invited to present their case in the National Finals at EXL Head Office, Gurgaon.

The winning team, Team Insidious from IIT Kharagpur received a cash prize of Rs. 1 Lakh along with certificates and winning trophy. Pre-placement interview offer was extended to all the 6 teams who made it to the National Finals.

short_message: We are in an age where the struggle for a decent enough living overpowers the all-round abilities within us. In this edition of  “JEWELS OF KGP”, we have
message:
We are in an age where the struggle for a decent enough living overpowers the all-round abilities within us. In this edition of “JEWELS OF KGP”, we have a person who has practiced and realized the meaning of all-round abilities in life. Presenting to you, Mr. Shailendra Kumar, one of the best all-rounders of 87' batch and the founder of Nalanda 2.0, a California based think-tank corporation that aims at improving the quality of higher education.

After completing his graduation in 1987, he applied his engineering skills in the automobile industry for two years. Thereafter, he pursued his MBA from Indiana University, Bloomington. From 1991 to 2006 he was an executive in several Fortune 500 and Silicon Valley-based corporation such as Applied Materials, FMC Corporation, and Lam Research, and he was co-founder and CEO of two startups. However, Shailendra Kumar realized his true potential when he spent around six years as an administrator for higher studies at UC Berkeley and San Diego. He spent over 16 months writing his book 'Building Golden India: How to unleash India's vast potential and transform its higher education system'. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur got a chance to interact with him and here we present an insight into his motivational professional and personal life.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/sh...

short_message: Ramya Veerubhotla, a Research Scholar from the Department of Biotechnology, has won the Platinum Award in the KPIT Sparkle 2018 for her innovation of a
message:
Ramya Veerubhotla, a Research Scholar from the Department of Biotechnology, has won the Platinum Award in the KPIT Sparkle 2018 for her innovation of a flexible and disposable battery that could generate power using the bacteria in sewage water. Among the twelve thousand students from across the country, she has been awarded the first prize for the novelty, affordability and the commercial viability of the proposed idea.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Ramya Veerubhotla and her PhD supervisor Prof. Debabrata Das for such a grand success!

Follow the links below for further information:
https://www.news18.com/ne... ; https://sparkle.kpit.com/...

short_message:
The KGPian Game Theory Society shared The Indian Game Theory Society's post.

Do you like to use or would like to use strategies to win?
story: The KGPian Game Theory Society shared The Indian Game Theory Society's post.
message:
The KGPian Game Theory Society shared The Indian Game Theory Society's post.

Do you like to use or would like to use strategies to win?

If you do, then get ready to stretch your mind to outwit your opponents.

The Indian Game Theory Society, in collaboration with Equipoise - The economics club of IIM Ahmedabad present to you “Stratazenith – strategize to reach the zenith”!

Stratazenith is a strategy based event modelled on game theory.

Event details:

Games will have problem statements based on simple real-life situations each having multiple rounds. After each round, the participants will be informed about their scores using which they can observe the behaviour of their opponents and strategize accordingly to maximise their scores.

You don’t need to have any prior knowledge to participate in the event.

Team size: 2

You only need to carry a pen.

Prizes worth INR 4,000 to be won!

Venue: CR7, New Campus, IIM Ahmedabad

Date: 25th February, Sunday

Time: 2:00 to 4:30pm
