short_message:
“WE, THE PEOPLE OF INDIA, having solemnly resolved to constitute India into a SOVEREIGN SOCIALIST SECULAR DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC…”
It’s no one else but
message:
“WE, THE PEOPLE OF INDIA, having solemnly resolved to constitute India into a SOVEREIGN SOCIALIST SECULAR DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC…”
It’s no one else but us who had taken this pledge long ago to make our country a better place not only in terms of lawfulness but also to achieve the transcendental goal of peace & harmony in the community which India comprises of. Our constitution is just a path towards building a good republic and with our honest intentions, we can constitute a healthy republic. Let’s commemorate the efforts of the historic intellectuals of our land in bringing out our nation to this level and put our efforts to head towards a better tomorrow.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a Happy Republic Day!

short_message: ‌Amidst the energetic spring, IIT Kharagpur celebrated the 69th Republic Day with great enthusiasm and warmth in the Jnan Ghosh Stadium. The celebrations
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 9 new photos — with Vishal Mahato and Arvind Reddy Bora.
message:
‌Amidst the energetic spring, IIT Kharagpur celebrated the 69th Republic Day with great enthusiasm and warmth in the Jnan Ghosh Stadium. The celebrations unfolded with our honourable Deputy Director Sriman Kumar Bhattacharyya hoisting the national flag followed by the national anthem sung in unison. The NCC wings marched thereafter along with NSS volunteers cheering up the celebrations. Professor S K Bhattacharyya also addressed the students and the guests in the programme. Kids from schools such as DAV, Kendriya Vidyalaya and Jagriti Vidya Mandir (JVM) depicted India's cultural diversity in their lovely performances. The programme also included a dance performance by students of Technology Dance Society (TDS) and a Nukkad Natak by students of Gopali Youth Welfare Society (GYWS).
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a warm Republic Day.

short_message: Technology giant Google has a mission to empower more and more people with internet access, thereby getting more people to sell to. In 2013, Google India
message:
Technology giant Google has a mission to empower more and more people with internet access, thereby getting more people to sell to. In 2013, Google India started converting the 163-year old Indian Railways into a fibre optic network to bring internet to all. Today, the service has expanded to more than 150 stations across the country, with more than 7 Million monthly active users!
The man heading this project is Gulzar Azad, who has converted the idea of setting up a 45,000 kilometres wireless infrastructure, into a reality!
Catch him live during The Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 from 2nd to 4th February.
#GES2k18

message:

He has been awarded Alfréd Rényi Prize from the Hungarian Academy of Sciences and has also been elected as a fellow of the American Mathematical Society for his contributions to discrete and combinatorial geometry and to convexity and combinatorics.

short_message: Don't we all get agitated due to the baseless links that pop up while reading some important news? A team of post graduate students and faculty members
message:
Don't we all get agitated due to the baseless links that pop up while reading some important news? A team of post graduate students and faculty members from IIT Kharagpur seem to have finally found a solution for these clickbaits, that is, webpages with luring titles but irrelevant content. IIT-KGP's solution is a browser extension named 'Stop Clickbait' that can detect and block clickbaits with more than 90% accuracy. Following this up, they are working with Microsoft to assess the relevance of the revenue models of such advertisements.

The team has analysed linguistic patterns and complemented it with tracking news and twitter posts of different national and international media channels over several months to develop this extension which already has over a 2000 downloads.

Prof. Niloy Ganguly, Department of Computer Science and Engineering, IIT Kharagpur says,
'Our primary aim is to offer a choice to the readers. If they like clickbaits, they are free to pursue them. If they don't like, our extension can come to the rescue.'

Read the complete article at:
https://m.economictimes.c...

short_message: Setting high benchmarks in the world of competitive coding, the team 'The Vindicators' that consists of three KGPians namely Pranjal Shankhdhar, Sandeep
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Sandeep Kumar Pani and 2 others.
message:
Setting high benchmarks in the world of competitive coding, the team 'The Vindicators' that consists of three KGPians namely Pranjal Shankhdhar, Sandeep Kumar Pani and Mayank Khetan, has qualified for the prestigious ACM-ICPC 2018 World Finals. They showcased immense coding prowess to come second in ACM ICPC Amritapuri Regionals where 255 teams were battling for a spot in the finals.
In world finals, there will be around 130 teams eyeing for the ultimate top honours. ACM-ICPC 2018 World Finals will be conducted on April 19, 2018 and will be hosted by Peking University and CYSCC: The Children and Youth Science Center of CAST (Beijing, China).

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire team and wishes them best for the finals!

short_message: IITs are well known as the premier institutes of the country for their work for the society. IIT Kharagpur proved the same yet again by boosting development
message:
IITs are well known as the premier institutes of the country for their work for the society. IIT Kharagpur proved the same yet again by boosting development of North-East through technological assistance. IIT Kharagpur has great capabilities in the Food Processing sector and has prepared the
ready-to-eat high energy food paste, which will be very beneficial for malnourished children between the age group of six months to six years.

The Agricultural and Food Engineering Department of IIT Kharagpur demonstrated the initiative of the development of technology and machinery for the production of ready-to-cook iron-fortified rice premix which is fully compatible with those of normal rice, catering to India's anemic population.
A patent has already been applied for producing rice from broken rice kernels using extrusion technology.
The Rural Technology Action Group (RuTAG) unit, led by Professor PB Singh Bhadoria of IIT Kharagpur will be the coordinating center for this mission of technologies for the North-East.

'We are now planning for high-end value-added products including those from turmeric, ginger, etc, in collaboration with BARC,'
IIT Kharagpur director Partha Pratim Chakrabarti said.
Source- http://www.millenniumpost...

short_message: Business Club, IIT Kharagpur in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur witnessed the completion of a successful 6th edition of the Indian Case Challenge.
story: Business Club, IIT Kharagpur added 7 new photos.
message:
Business Club, IIT Kharagpur in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur witnessed the completion of a successful 6th edition of the Indian Case Challenge. ICC 2018 saw clashes of brilliant ideas and great solutions from over 1300 participants spanning all of India. The winning teams were :
1st position: Team Autospy, IIT Kharagpur
2nd position: Team SCMites, SCMS Pune
3rd position: Team Cryptocorrupt, IIT Madras

We congratulate the winning teams and thank all the participants who made the event a big success.

short_message: Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur and Nomura present guest lecture by Laxmi Agarwal, an Indian campaigner with Stop Acid Attacks. She is an acid attack survivor
message:
Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur and Nomura present guest lecture by Laxmi Agarwal, an Indian campaigner with Stop Acid Attacks. She is an acid attack survivor and speaks for the rights of acid attack victims. Currently, she is the director of Chhanv Foundation, a NGO dedicated to help the survivors of acid attacks in India. Laxmi received a 2014 International Women of Courage award by US First Lady Michelle Obama. She was also chosen as the NDTV Indian of the Year.

Be there on 26th of January, Kalidas Auditorium.

#Umang
#GuestLecture
#SpringFest2018

short_message:
'वर दे, वीणावादिनी वर दे!

प्रिय स्वतंत्र- रव अमृत-मंत्र नव
भारत में भर दे!

काट अंध्-उर के बंधन-स्तर
बहा जननि, ज्योतिर्मय
message:
'वर दे, वीणावादिनी वर दे!

प्रिय स्वतंत्र- रव अमृत-मंत्र नव
भारत में भर दे!

काट अंध्-उर के बंधन-स्तर
बहा जननि, ज्योतिर्मय निर्झर
कलुष-भेद-तम हर प्रकाश भर
जगमग जग कर दे!

नव गति, नव लय, ताल-छंद नव
नवल कंठ, नव जलद-मन्द्र रव
नव नभ के नव विहग-वृंद को
नव पर, नव स्वर दे!

वर दे, वीणावादिनी वर दे।'

महाकवि सूर्यकांत त्रिपाठी 'निराला' द्वारा रचित यह सरस्वती वंदना नव-भारत के निर्माण का आह्वान है। आवाज़, आईआईटी खड़गपुर की ओर से सभी को सरस्वती पूजा एवं वसंत पंचमी की हार्दिक शुभकामनाएं।

short_message: In the last 5 years, Startup activity in India has gained immense velocity. While you might be willing to toil and put everything on the line to launch
story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
In the last 5 years, Startup activity in India has gained immense velocity. While you might be willing to toil and put everything on the line to launch your dream venture, numbers aren't quite good on your side, 90% of the startups fail.
At the beginning, you need to accelerate your startup's growth substantially.

Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur presents a series of Startup Growth hacking workshops where eminent personalities from different industries will talk about different aspects of scaling up a new venture.
Catch them live during GES'18 from 2nd-4th February!
Register at: www.ges.ecell-iitkgp.org
#GES2k18

short_message: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur in association with Matrix Partners calls out to all the entrepreneurs, innovators and investors from the KGP community
message:
Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur in association with Matrix Partners calls out to all the entrepreneurs, innovators and investors from the KGP community to come together and celebrate this vibrant ecosystem of our startups through KAN. We look forward to seeing you all at the Matrix Partners Bangalore office Rooftop on 24th January. As always, KGP ka tempo high hai!

As part of the event, we are delighted to announce that we will have Amod Malviya (Co-founder, Udaan) and Rajesh Yabaji (Cofounder and CEO, Blackbuck) join in a panel discussion on 'All things Kgp and Startup' moderated by Raghav Nagarajan, Investment Professional from Matrix.

If you are interested in being a part of the Panel Discussion and Networking session please RSVP here: https://tinyurl.com/ecell...

If you are an Investor who wants to discover the IIT Kharagpur startup ecosystem, apply here: http://ecell-iitkgp.org/k...

PS: The networking event is invite only as seats are limited, please fill in the form early!

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos — with Abhinav Raj and Shiv Prakash Kaundinya.
message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Cricket

Match 1: LBS vs MMM1
MMM1 won the match by 20 runs.
MMM1: 114/6 (16 overs)
LBS: 94/9 (16 overs)

Match 2: RK vs AZ
AZ won the match by 2 wickets.
RK: 91/8 (16 overs)
AZ: 91/8 (14.5 overs)
Due to slow over rate of RK, the match couldn't finish within the time. Requiring 1 run to win, AZ was declared the winner.

short_message: Melvin Thambi, Creative Director at RapidValue talks about the power of inspiration and how consequences inspired him to become one of the most celebrated
message:
Melvin Thambi, Creative Director at RapidValue talks about the power of inspiration and how consequences inspired him to become one of the most celebrated Graphic Designers in the world, with more than 10 years of experience in creating user interface design for the web, mobile devices and digital applications.
Unfortunately, he will not be able to make it to GES 2018, and through this video, he explains the importance of networking and wishes us all the best for the summit.

Register at: www.ges.ecell-iitkgp.org/...
#GES2k18

short_message:
The fifteenth edition of Kshitij was inaugurated in Kalidas Auditorium last night.
The event began with the traditional lighting of the lamp, followed
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 4 new photos.
message:
The fifteenth edition of Kshitij was inaugurated in Kalidas Auditorium last night.
The event began with the traditional lighting of the lamp, followed by the Director's welcome speech for all the participants, the guests of honour and the chief guest of the event, Mr. Kaushik Dutta, Joint General Manager of the title sponsors of Kshitij-2018, L&T Ltd.

Following the motivational words of the Director and Mr. Dutta for the excited participants, faculty member Prof. Jitendra Kumar delivered the vote of thanks to the guests and all the people who have burnt the midnight oil to make Kshitij a reality.

Dean of Student Affairs, Prof. Somesh Kumar introduced the audience to Dr. Rajendra Singh, who then delivered the introductory lecture. Dr. Rajendra Singh, who is a guest of honour for the event, is a water conservationist and is renowned as the Waterman of India.

short_message: French Embassy in India and Institut Francais en Inde (IFI) is organizing the Future tour for the first time that brings together scientists, academics
message:
French Embassy in India and Institut Francais en Inde (IFI) is organizing the Future tour for the first time that brings together scientists, academics and companies to discuss future partnerships between India and France under the third edition of Bonjour India in five different cities from 29th January - 18th February 2018.
The objective of these Future Tours are:
- to bring about joint initiatives in training, research and innovation.
- to promote the French training offer and to meet the students.
The agenda of the meeting is also to explore possibilities of collaboration and to deliver recommendations for the first high level Indo-French Knowledge Summit which will transpire in New Delhi in mid-March 2018 in the presence of President of France and Prime Minister of India.

This Summit will bring together academia and industry from both countries to create a road map for education, research cooperation and mobility for the next 5 years.

https://drive.google.com/...

'It will not be an overstatement to say that Go will be the server language of the future.'
message:
20th Jan (Tomorrow) | NR223 | 2:00 PM

'It will not be an overstatement to say that Go will be the server language of the future.'

Go, is an Open Source Programming language created at Google, created with system design in mind. It is statically typed which enables it to gain speed comparable to C/C++ but with the ease of dynamic language syntax. Read more on why should you learn Go[1].

And if you already know about this, how about removing the to-do 'Learn Go' from your mind and do that tomorrow itself at 2PM?

short_message: IITians are well known for their innovative ideas which have always been helping the society. Mr. Prateek Sharma, an alumnus of IIT Delhi has proved the
message:
IITians are well known for their innovative ideas which have always been helping the society. Mr. Prateek Sharma, an alumnus of IIT Delhi has proved the same in a louder voice. The team of IIT alumni including Mr. Sharma, professors and other students have developed an anti-pollution filter which costs only Rs.10.
The motivation behind this unbelievably cheap product was his asthma-prone mother. She had to face suffocation with the mask and apart from solving this problem, Nasofilters also protects people against allergies. These innovators had also won the ‘Startup national Award’ for their product in May 2017. For more details, follow the link below:
https://fit.thequint.com/...

short_message: For last 3-4 years, it has been observed that the amount of MCM scholarship used to get credited to the students' bank accounts within the first week of
message:
For last 3-4 years, it has been observed that the amount of MCM scholarship used to get credited to the students' bank accounts within the first week of the semester. But it has been around 16 days since the commencement of this semester and the MCM scholarship amount hasn't been credited yet. When our team tried to dig this matter up, what we found was something that reveals the sheer negligence of some of the students. Around 50-60 students haven't updated their bank details (Account numbers and other information) and since the MCM scholarship is credited batch-wise at once, incomplete bank details of some students are the reason why the amount hasn't been credited yet.
These concerned students have been mailed and informed many times to update their bank details but to no avail! Due to some of the students, many students who used to pay their semester fees with the MCM scholarship money have not been able to register yet. Other students who are in dire need of financial assistance and MCM has been their only source for the same, are also facing difficulties of various degrees. As more details were revealed, it was found out that some students have also filled invalid contact numbers and account numbers (containing alphabets) such as MV34GK984P.
This kind of sheer negligence and carelessness on students' part is gross irresponsibility on students' part and goes on to show that how insensitive have they become towards abiding by the rules and regulations. And their negligence has affected not only them but also many of the needy students who would have liked to get the scholarship as soon as possible.
We would like to appeal to the student community to fill the necessary details as soon as possible. Also, we all should make efforts henceforth so that such kind of incidents do not get repeated in the future.

short_message:
FutureTour on Smart Cities-Electical Mobility and Connectivity

French Embassy in India and Institut Francais en Inde (IFI) is organizing the
message:
FutureTour on Smart Cities-Electical Mobility and Connectivity

French Embassy in India and Institut Francais en Inde (IFI) is organizing the Future tour for the first time that brings together scientists, academics and companies to discuss future partnerships between India and France under the third edition of Bonjour India in five different cities from 29th January - 18th February 2018.
The objective of these Future Tours are:
- to bring about joint initiatives in training, research and innovation.
- to promote the French training offer and to meet the students.
The agenda of the meeting is also to explore possibilities of collaboration and to deliver recommendations for the first high level Indo-French Knowledge Summit which will transpire in New Delhi in mid-March 2018 in the presence of President of France and Prime Minister of India.

https://drive.google.com/...

message:
Microsoft is back with their flagship coding competition code.fun.do. Following last year’s format all the 1st and 2nd year UG students need to compete in an online Hackathon out of which three teams will qualify for the final Hackathon. Attendance in the bootcamp is mandatory for UG 1st and 2nd year students.

The online hackathon will be held between 6th March to 12th March whereas the on-campus round will be held over-night on March 24 9:00 AM to March 25 2:00 PM.

Important registration deadlines : -
-> Bootcamp - Registration - March 2, 11:59 PM
-> Code.fun.do Online Qualifier - Team creation - March 8, 11:59 PM, Project Submission - March 12, 11:59 PM
-> Code.fun.do On-campus - Team creation - March 21, 11:59 PM

short_message: In a remarkable decision taken by the Senate on the recommendation of Undergraduate Programme Evaluation Committee, B.Tech. Project (BTP) has been made
message:
In a remarkable decision taken by the Senate on the recommendation of Undergraduate Programme Evaluation Committee, B.Tech. Project (BTP) has been made optional with effect from academic session 2018-19. In what is being hailed as one of the most impactful academic reforms in recent times, students have been given the freedom to take subjects of equivalent credits in place of BTP.
Also, a student can register for B.Tech. projects in other departments and such projects will be evaluated by the department where the student is pursuing the project. Students pursuing minors or micro-specialisations and research output of IIT Kharagpur - both are bound to get affected by this new provision. This decision is expected to take most of the students by surprise for sure and the academic landscape will see a probable drastic change from the next academic session.

NOTICE
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
On the recommendation of the Undergraduate Programme Evaluation Committee, the Senate at its 323rd meeting held on 22nd December 2017, approved the following revised rules/guidelines for B.Tech Project (BTP) with effect from Academic Session 2018-2019.

1) The B.Tech project will be optional. BTP-I will be of 3 credits and BTP-II will be of 6 credits.

2) Allotment of projects will be done once the list of students who opt for BTP will be available in the 6th semester.

3) If a student opted BTP-I in Autumn Semester, then the faculty supervisor should inform whether BTP-II is necessary in the Spring semester.

4) After Autumn Semester, the student will have two options:
I. The student can continue with BTP-II as an extension of
BTP-I in the Spring Semester, OR
II. The student will be allowed to take theory subjects of
equivalent credit in the Spring Semester in lieu of BTP-II, if
there is no condition attached by faculty supervisor at the
beginning.

5) A student who does not opt for BTP must take subjects of equivalent credit in both Autumn and Spring semesters.

6) A student can also register for B.Tech projects in other departments (with necessary approval of the Head of the Department in which he/she is originally enrolled, and the Head of the Department in which he/she wants to pursue B.Tech project), and in that case, the project will be evaluated by the department where the student is pursuing the project in both the semesters.

short_message: The KGPians have created their profound impression for providing solutions to the social and technological challenges with their unmatched intellect and
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Shyama Agrawal and Anurag Goyal.
message:
The KGPians have created their profound impression for providing solutions to the social and technological challenges with their unmatched intellect and here is another brick stone to this. The students from Prodex, IIT Kharagpur represented the institute in the ‘Innovation’ wing of the Intercontinental Multi-Genre Talent Hunt Competition - ‘Masterpiece 2017’ organized by Living Talent. The very first edition of this competition was held in Dubai where 75 teams from all over the world were selected to showcase their innovative and appealing projects in the semi-finals. The students from IIT Kharagpur presented their product model ‘Vibronot’ to control the symptoms of Parkinson's disease.
The product with the potential it carried, was not only shortlisted for the finals which included only total 15 teams but was also declared as one of the best solutions to the particular disorder. The product idea was aimed at facilitating the old age life by making the patients self-reliant for their day-to-day activities.
Living Talent is a Talent Hunt Company which aims to bring brilliant individuals from the globe under an umbrella to motivate and appreciate their talent in three different genres namely, Performance, Art & Craft and Innovation. ‘Masterpiece 2017’ was the first event of under their banner and more such events are to be organized annually. We hope KGPians will keep on repeating such performances and bring laurels to the institute.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Team Prodex for their earnest efforts followed by an excellent performance!

short_message:
For all the Bollywood cinephiles present out there, the time has come!
Few filmmakers carry a signature style that separates their work from others,
message:
For all the Bollywood cinephiles present out there, the time has come!
Few filmmakers carry a signature style that separates their work from others, and Imtiaz Ali is one of them. His direction of Jab We Met earned him critical and commercial success while Love Aaj Kal and Rockstar made him a noted filmmaker.There is an effortless realism in his films, a sense of ease in which his characters converse - they often tend to verbalise their emotions.

Be there at TOAT on 21st January to learn the other sides of his story, the unspoken lines, and the unwritten verse.
#KTJ2k18
#Imtiaz_Ali

short_message: Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur along with Bengal Energy Limited and Inshorts present Penathlon, the online creative writing event, in association with Write
message:
Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur along with Bengal Energy Limited and Inshorts present Penathlon, the online creative writing event, in association with Write India.
You can submit your entry on any one of the following themes with a word limit of 2000 words to penathlon.sf18@ gmail.com .

1. Media, both informative and social, should be held accountable for the veracity of information propagated by/through it.
2. All cryptocurrencies should be banned.
3. Man Booker Prize should be decided by popular vote.

With a Cash Prize of INR 7000 up for grabs. Let your thoughts flow free and your words shape perspectives!

short_message: With great disappointment and grief i am writing this.  I donno whether this writing will have any effect or not, but I have to say. I am a border of JCB
message:
With great disappointment and grief i am writing this. I donno whether this writing will have any effect or not, but I have to say. I am a border of JCB Hall. I am facing poor management and communication this year of spring fest team. I am here in iit kgp for last 7.5 years, and this 2018 is going to be my 8th spring fest. Every year i order spring fest t-shirt and/or sweat-shirt, is like a symbol of my presence or memory of staying here in iit, i preserve them with emotions.
This year i donno what is the management team is doing. When they have posted the website link http://2018.merchandise.s... /. to order in this fb page, i ordered within 23 minutes. in the website it was 'A Springfest representative will come to you......' and alas! NOBODY came to JCB Hall. If you are not taking orders according to the website, then what is the point of making one?? Today i called on your given contact, they are saying 'the stocks are over, we are not taking anymore order, we are sorry'... Will your sorry can provide me the memento of this spring fest for my future memories??? I donno whether i will get any merchandise or not, but i am sad..

short_message: IIT Kharagpur conferred the first ever Learn-Earn-Return Fellow Award to 3 of its 1st-year students. The award was instituted by Prof P P Chakrabarti,
message:
IIT Kharagpur conferred the first ever Learn-Earn-Return Fellow Award to 3 of its 1st-year students. The award was instituted by Prof P P Chakrabarti, Director IIT Kharagpur, IIT Kharagpur, in July 2016 with the funding crowdsourced from the alumni. Jyoti Agrawal, Jyotisman Das and Rathin Singha from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering were the recipients. The fellow award was conferred on the occasion of the Annual Alumni Meet on January 13, 2018 in the presence of about 300 alumni who came from India and abroad.

Each of the students will receive Rs. 10000/- per month for 4 years as a cash award. At the end of the first semester of the 1st year, it will be awarded based on JEE Advanced rank. From second semester onward the recipients of the award would have to maintain a CGPA 9.

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the students and hopes these awards would bloom into a beautiful support system between our alumni and our students.

Read on to know more:
http://alumni.iitkgp.ac.i...

short_message: The Indian startup eco-system has seen tremendous growth and value creation in the last decade. IIT Kharagpur, with over 200 startups from campus, has
message:
The Indian startup eco-system has seen tremendous growth and value creation in the last decade. IIT Kharagpur, with over 200 startups from campus, has been on the forefront of this startup revolution.

Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur hence calls out to all the entrepreneurs, innovators and investors from the KGP community to come together and celebrate this vibrant ecosystem of our startups through KAN. We look forward to seeing you all at the Matrix Partners Bangalore office Rooftop on 24th January. As always, KGP ka tempo high hai!

If you are a startup which has at least one KGP co-founder and are looking to raise funding, apply here: http://ecell-iitkgp.org/k... (Deadline Monday 15th Jan 2018)

If you are an Investor who wants to discover the IIT Kharagpur startup ecosystem, apply here: http://ecell-iitkgp.org/k...

If you are interested in being a part of the Networking session and further meet a lot of KGP people, apply here: https://tinyurl.com/ecell...

PS: The networking event is invite only as seats are limited, please fill in the form early!

short_message: Yes, it is that time of the year again when you have to convert coffee to code. I hope you all know that Google Summer of Code is approaching soon
story: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS added an event.
message:
Yes, it is that time of the year again when you have to convert coffee to code. I hope you all know that Google Summer of Code is approaching soon and the Selected Organization list is going to be published on Feb 12.
Therefore, we are planning to conduct a seminar on how to overcome the initial barrier and we will also provide you a lot of insights about GSoC program by people who have cracked GSoC before as students and as mentors. The mentors will provide you even better insights of how they select students and much more stuff.
Thus we hope to see you for the GSoC seminar on Wednesday, 17th January at 6.00pm Kalidas Auditorium.
Cheers!
Date: 06:00PM
Time: 17-01-2018
Veunu: Kalidas Auditorium

short_message: The 15th Annual Alumni meet has officially began! Day 1 of the three day event began with a campus tour followed by a departmental visit. A 'Musical Night'
message:
The 15th Annual Alumni meet has officially began! Day 1 of the three day event began with a campus tour followed by a departmental visit. A 'Musical Night' was organised in which the a few alumni of the '93 batch who had a band named 'Still Waters' took to the stage to perform some age old classics after a gap of 25 years. The performance was scintillating!

Approximately 300 alumni, from the batches of '68, '78, and '93, are enjoying their return back to campus.

One of the alumni who was also a part of the Springfest organising committee expressed his jubilation on coming back for the first time since graduation.
'A lot has changed. There are roads and pathways everywhere. Boys are definitely more disciplined than we were. I wish I could have those days back', he told The Scholars' Avenue.

Day 1 of the meet will come to an end with the much anticipated hall visits.

short_message: Prof. Suman Chakraborty, Professor at the Department of Mechanical Engineering, Associate Dean (SRIC) and Head, School of Medical Science and Technology
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
message:
Prof. Suman Chakraborty, Professor at the Department of Mechanical Engineering, Associate Dean (SRIC) and Head, School of Medical Science and Technology has been conferred with the Fellowship of The Royal Society of Chemistry, United Kingdom. The Royal Society of Chemistry (RSC) is a learned society (founded in 1980) in the United Kingdom with the goal of 'advancing the chemical sciences'.

With this, Prof. Chakraborty has yet again made the whole institute proud. He joined the institute in 2002. He already has many awards and honours to his name including the highest scientific honour from the Government of India i.e., Shanti Swaroop Bhatnagar Prize (2013) and Scopus Young Scientist Award (2008). His research area includes Microfluidics and Nanofluidics, Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) etc. He has been the pioneer to agglomerate the science of microscale fluid mechanics with the complex biophysics of cells. He has also been the first researcher to develop a fundamental theory on the electrokinetic transport of blood through microfluidic conduits. He has about 340 research papers to his name, accepted by reputed journals.
Last year, in April, we had a talk with Prof. Chakraborty where he had discussed his journey, engineering, Ph.D., hobbies etc. Give it a read here: http://awaaziitkgp.org/su...

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him for this feat and wishes all the best for future endeavours!

.

short_message: Have you ever known an entrepreneur who has devoted all her entrepreneurial skills to bring smiles on the faces of thousands of little kids? We are glad
message:
Have you ever known an entrepreneur who has devoted all her entrepreneurial skills to bring smiles on the faces of thousands of little kids? We are glad to present to you one such entrepreneur in the series of 'Know Your Entrepreneur'. This time, we interviewed Nancy Charaya (IIT Kharagpur, B.Arch. batch of 2015), the COO of Anthill Creations - a team of five passionate architecture graduates who have been working towards coming up with architectural solutions to emerging problems in society that includes constructing playgrounds and libraries for needy kids. It is one of the eight early-stage non-profit startups selected for an 18-month incubation programme by the NS Raghavan Centre for Entrepreneurial Learning (NSRCEL) at the prestigious Indian Institute of Management (IIM), Bangalore.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/KYE9.php

short_message: Small unmanned aerial vehicles have numerous applications in civilian sectors in which stable, controllable flight of the vehicle through precise manipulation
message:
Small unmanned aerial vehicles have numerous applications in civilian sectors in which stable, controllable flight of the vehicle through precise manipulation of the aerodynamic surfaces is required. A flight computer, the “autopilot,” translates higher-level commands into appropriate instructions to the surfaces and hence, it makes up for a pilot.
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Asteria Aerospace Pvt. Ltd. presents a tech-talk on the topic 'Autopilot for Unmanned Aerial Systems'.

Register at www.ktj.in/workshop
#KTJ2k18

short_message: Small unmanned aerial vehicles have numerous applications in civilian sectors, In all these applications, stable, controllable flight of the vehicle is
message:
Small unmanned aerial vehicles have numerous applications in civilian sectors, In all these applications, stable, controllable flight of the vehicle is essential.The controllable flight of aircraft requires the precise manipulation of aerodynamic surfaces. Pilots do not affect these actuators directly. Instead, a flight computer, the “autopilot,” translates higher-level commands into appropriate commands to the surfaces.
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Asteria Aerospace Pvt. Ltd. Pvt. Ltd. presents a tech-talk on the topic 'Autopilot for Unmanned Aerial Systems'.

Register at www.ktj.in/workshop

#KTJ2k18

Halls of residence serve
story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
message:
When you join IIT Kharagpur, you don't just the institution, you join a family with rich culture and lots of caring people!
Halls of residence serve as the second homes and for the same, Interaction Rooms are started in several halls of residence as an initiative of the Students' Welfare, TSG where students can go to spend time, express and take advice from faculty, student representatives and other senior students in various fields!
Kindly take this opportunity to gain proper funda and create a good relation with those who 'care' for you!
The details of the halls which will have their rooms functional from today are attached. Other halls shall also start their rooms soon and you will be intimated regarding the same.
The schedules, occupancy and availability of the room shall be internally circulated by the G.Sec Student Welfare in each hall of residence.

short_message: Small unmanned aerial vehicles have numerous applications in civilian sectors in which stable, controllable flight of the vehicle through precise manipulation
message:
Small unmanned aerial vehicles have numerous applications in civilian sectors in which stable, controllable flight of the vehicle through precise manipulation of the aerodynamic surfaces is required. A flight computer, the “autopilot,” translates higher-level commands into appropriate instructions to the surfaces and hence, it makes up for a pilot.
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Asteria Aerospace presents a tech-talk on the topic 'Autopilot for Unmanned Aerial Systems'.

Register at www.ktj.in/workshop
#KTJ2k18

short_message: 3 Golds and 1 Silver in last four Inter IIT Technology Meets! Which team does that? No team does that unless it's IIT Kharagpur! The kind of legacy that
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Swarnabha Roy and 21 others.
message:
3 Golds and 1 Silver in last four Inter IIT Technology Meets! Which team does that? No team does that unless it's IIT Kharagpur! The kind of legacy that IIT KGP has built over the years has earned them the tag of 'Tech Giants' among the IITs. The technical prowess seems to be in the culture of KGP that makes this back to back sweeping of medals and podiums in the tech meet look so effortless. But a lot goes into the background while preparing for the same. And that's why all the team members of Inter IIT Tech contingent deserve a thunderous applause.
The contingent captain Rishabh Shrivastava puts this victory into words, “I'm extremely proud of the contingent which performed astonishingly well to come on top among 19 IITs (highest number of IITs participating in any inter IIT Meet). A big shout-out to the tempo of the contingent which superseded the lack of resources provided to us and kept believing in themselves. We won by huge margins in the real-life problem statements that were put forward by different industries and such a high quality performance of KGPians is a clear indication of the fact that IIT KGP is way ahead in tackling real world issues.”
As General Secretary Technology (TSG), Anusha Sharan puts it by stating, 'Having received podium positions in the Inter IIT Tech Meet for the past four years with 3 Gold and 1 Silver, the Tech contingents have more than proved their mettle as compared to the other IITs. And it deserves a bit more spotlight in terms of resources and attention.'
Some participants do admit that things could have been bit better when it comes to timely and adequate allocation of resources. They felt that there was a bit inconvenience due to lack of timely and proper assistance that should have been ideally provided. All we can say for now is 'All is well that ends well'. We wish to see KGP reach to newer heights in the field of real life problem solving through its technical prowess and congratulate all the participants again for bringing laurels to the institution.

short_message:
||6th Inter-IIT Technology Meet||

Here we present the summary of the 6th Inter-IIT Tech Meet which was hosted by IIT Madras from 5th-7th January.
message:
||6th Inter-IIT Technology Meet||

Here we present the summary of the 6th Inter-IIT Tech Meet which was hosted by IIT Madras from 5th-7th January. IIT Kharagpur contingent showcased an excellent piece of intellect, skills and teamwork leading towards the overall Gold. KGP finished on podium in 8 out of 10 events bagging 6 Golds, 1 Silver and 1 Bronze. With this tremendous performance, IIT-KGP surpassed the rest of the IITs and finally left them far behind. Weighted sum of the points in all the events is as follows:
1. IIT Kharagpur: 888 Pts.
2. IIT Roorkee: 668 Pts.
3. IIT Madras: 650 Pts.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur once again congratulates the participants for their grand success!

Automatic Toilet Cleaning: 100

Orbital Simulator: 100
Technology for Soldier Support: 0
Total score: 832.1052632

We were followed by IIT Roorkee (668.4210526) and IIT Madras (650).

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the whole contingent for emerging victorious with flying colors.

short_message:
Inter IIT Technology Meet | IIT Kharagpur stamps their authority again in style
The stakes were bound to skyrocket when the finest brains of India
message:
Inter IIT Technology Meet | IIT Kharagpur stamps their authority again in style
The stakes were bound to skyrocket when the finest brains of India from 19 IITs came together to showcase their technical skills and win top honours in the Inter IIT Technology Meet that was hosted by IIT Madras from 5th to 7th January. Bigger the stage, better are the KGPians! They left no stone unturned to bring home the championship and finished with individual medals in 8 (6 Golds, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) of the total 10 events. With such a spectacular performance, they won the overall championship (Gold) with IIT Roorkee taking home the silver and hosts i.e., IIT Madras had to settle for bronze.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates each and every team member of the Inter IIT Technology Contingent along with the captain, General Secretaries, Professors and others who were directly or indirectly involved in taking the performance of the team to new heights.

short_message:
Director IIT Kharagpur shared Indo-US Science and Technology Forum's post.

The Department of Science & Technology (DST), Govt. of India
story: Director IIT Kharagpur shared Indo-US Science and Technology Forum's post.
message:
Director IIT Kharagpur shared Indo-US Science and Technology Forum's post.

The Department of Science & Technology (DST), Govt. of India and Indo-U.S. Science & Technology Forum (IUSSTF) jointly announce a new fellowship program for Women “Indo-U.S. Fellowship for Women in STEMM (WISTEMM)” (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics and Medicine). The program aims to provide opportunities to Indian Women Scientists, Engineers & Technologists to undertake international collaborative research in premier institutions in U.S.A, to enhance their research capacities and capabilities. The deadline for submission of applications is 28th February 2018. More information about the Program is available on our website http://iusstf.org/story/5...

short_message: Indian National Academy of Engineering (INAE), the premier engineering body of the Nation is organizing the second Online National Essay Competition for
message: Indian National Academy of Engineering (INAE), the premier engineering body of the Nation is organizing the second Online National Essay Competition for B.Tech/BE/BSc(Tech)/Integrated MTech/ ME from all MHRD/AICTE approved institutions and universities in its endeavour to associate and engage with young engineers. All 4th-year students from above courses are eligible to apply. The topic for this competition is- 'National Challenge and the Engineering Solution'. This Competition will have one grand prize of Rs. 1 lakh and 12 other prizes as well. For submission and more information, interested ones can visit- http://essay.inae.in/logi... . The deadline for the same is 28th February 2018.

short_message: IIT Kharagpur has joined hands with three Ivy League Universities of the United States for a geo-hydrological exploratory study of river Ganga at Varanasi.
message:
IIT Kharagpur has joined hands with three Ivy League Universities of the United States for a geo-hydrological exploratory study of river Ganga at Varanasi. Professor Partha Pratim Chakrabarti (Director, IIT Kharagpur) and Prof Rajeev Sangal (Director, IIT BHU) are the two key advisers of the water urbanism project. The project is part of the multi-focal point of research under the Science and Heritage Initiative (SandHI) spearheaded by IIT Kharagpur. A 50-member team of students, research scholars and academicians from three Ivy League US universities are collaborating with IIT Kharagpur.
Source: https://www.ndtv.com/educ...

short_message: IIT Kharagpur welcomes two new deans, Prof. Manoj Tiwari as the new Dean for Planning & Coordination and Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya as the Dean for Alumni
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
message:
IIT Kharagpur welcomes two new deans, Prof. Manoj Tiwari as the new Dean for Planning & Coordination and Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya as the Dean for Alumni Affairs and International Relations.
Prof. Tiwari, a professor at the department of Industrial and Systems Engineering joined the institute in 2007 and have brought laurels to the institute with his extraordinary research, being rated 2nd among many researchers working in Logistics and Supply Chain Management in India and has many other achievements in his kitty that sets him apart.
Prof. Bhattacharya, who joined the Civil Engineering Department of the institute in 2006, is an associate faculty at the Centre for Theoretical Studies and was serving as the Associate Dean for Alumni Affairs and International Relations.
IIT Kharagpur is extremely grateful to Prof. Biswajit Mohanty and Prof. Siddhartha Mukhopadhyay, whose relentless services as former Dean P & C and Dean AA & IR helped the institute take long strides towards excellence.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes the newly appointed deans, who assume office this semester onwards, a bright and fruitful tenure.

IIT Kharagpur welcomes two new deans, Prof. Manoj Tiwari as the new Dean for Planning & Coordination and Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya as the Dean for Alumni Affairs and International Relations.
Prof. Tiwari, a professor at the department of Industrial and Systems Engineering joined the institute in 2007 and have brought laurels to the institute with his extraordinary research, being rated 2nd among many researchers working in Logistics and Supply Chain Management in India and so many other achievements as testimony to it.
Prof. Bhattacharya, who joined the Civil Engineering Department of the institute in 2006, is an associate faculty at the Centre for Theoretical Studies and was serving as the Associate Dean for Alumni Affairs and International Relations.
IIT Kharagpur is extremely grateful to Prof. Biswajit Mohanty and Prof. Siddhartha Mukhopadhyay, whose relentless services as former Deans, P & C and AA & IR helped the institute take long strides towards excellence.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes the newly appointed deans who assume office this semester onwards a bright and fruitful tenure.

Debating Society, IIT Kharagpur congratulates its contingent to the Inter IIT Social and Cultural Meet for their gold-winning performance.
The Parliamentary
story: Debating Society,IIT  Kharagpur is with Vignesh Viswanathan and 3 others.
message:
Debating Society, IIT Kharagpur congratulates its contingent to the Inter IIT Social and Cultural Meet for their gold-winning performance.
The Parliamentary debate had Vishal Chauhan, Partha Kadambi and Gyan Darshan as debaters, and Tanay Jagani, Aradhana Kumar and Vignesh Viswanathan as adjudicators and we secured gold in the event this year as well retaining our title as defending champions.
The Turncoat event had Rohit Sar and Chandar Siddarth participating and we bagged a gold in this event as well.
Congratulations to all of them!!

short_message: Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Technology Robotix Society presents you 'Poles Apart'. The engineers are trying to design a vehicle that is
message:
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Technology Robotix Society presents you 'Poles Apart'. The engineers are trying to design a vehicle that is capable of adapting itself to the rough terrain it is sent into. You are asked to design the prototype of such a bot that is capable of changing the distance between its wheels so as to cover a ground that cannot be done otherwise. There are multiple valleys that converge, diverge or are in an arc form and are to be crossed.
Your challenge is to design a bot robust enough to adapt itself according to the valleys it faces. There are also certain parts of the path that you need to complete before you can cover the further ground. Use a mechanical gripper to complete this problem statement.

Prizes Worth INR 45,000
For more information go to: www.robotix.in/event/pole...
Register at www.ktj.in/event
#KTJ2k18

Inter IIT Cultural Meet

The 2nd Inter IIT Cultural Meet was held at IIT Kanpur from 28th to 30th December. It was filled with various brilliant
message:
Inter IIT Cultural Meet

The 2nd Inter IIT Cultural Meet was held at IIT Kanpur from 28th to 30th December. It was filled with various brilliant performances and IIT Kharagpur gained a remarkable 3rd position. The spectacular performance displayed by our teams throughout the Cultural Meet was appreciable.
Our teams lifted the Literary and Quiz cup as well as the Music Cup.

Here are the final standings of the Cultural Meet:
Gold: IIT Delhi
Silver: IIT Bombay
Bronze: IIT Kharagpur

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning IITs and applauds the exquisite performance of our contingent who performed extremely well throughout the meet. We hope for even better performances in the coming years.

short_message: IIT Kharagpur and Tata Medical Center have signed a MoU through which they will soon enter into an institutional collaboration in education, research and
message:
IIT Kharagpur and Tata Medical Center have signed a MoU through which they will soon enter into an institutional collaboration in education, research and outreach programmes in the field of interdisciplinary medical research and technology. The primary objective is to promote collaborative research projects. Through MoU, it is planned to offer joint programs that will eventually lead to master's degree programs. The integrated M.Sc. - PhD is likely to focus in its first phase on medical physics, nuclear medicine and molecular medical microbiology. This would involve students spending at least one semester in each institute with joint supervision by faculty and scientists of both institutions. The degree will be awarded by IIT Kharagpur.

Source: https://timesofindia.indi...

short_message: In a first among the IITs, IIT Kharagpur will soon start certifying food items at its campus for their nutritional value and also check for adulteration.
message:
In a first among the IITs, IIT Kharagpur will soon start certifying food items at its campus for their nutritional value and also check for adulteration.
The Analytical Food Testing (AFT) Laboratory at IIT Kharagpur received the National Accreditation Board for Calibration and Testing Laboratories' (NABL) accreditation this month.The lab has the most sophisticated high-end equipment to check for adulteration and quality, and is at par with any international laboratory, according to Professor Rintu Banerjee, Department of Agricultural and Food Engineering and the in-charge of AFT Laboratory.
This is for the first time that any lab in any of the IITs or NITs has been given this accreditation, which has certified food testing in the laboratory.

Source: https://economictimes.ind...

short_message: TL; DR: Do you know if your department has a lift/ramp/handicapped toilet? Help us make this information widely available for your fellow students.
message:
TL; DR: Do you know if your department has a lift/ramp/handicapped toilet? Help us make this information widely available for your fellow students.

Greetings KGP!
National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) recently published their yearly rankings for 2017 of educational institutions in India, in which IIT Kharagpur was placed 4th in the overall rankings.

One of the parameters used by NIRF for ranking is 'Facilities for Physically Challenged Students' which asks the following questions:
1. Does your institution have Lifts/Ramps?
2. Does your institution have provision for walking aids, including wheelchairs and transportation from one building to another for handicapped students?
3. Does your institution have specially designed toilets for handicapped students?

We believe this information isn't immediately accessible to the students as well as the administration currently and would like your help gathering it. Please take a minute and help us by editing the relevant Wiki page here:
https://wiki.metakgp.org/...

short_message:
| A tale of perseverance and resilience – rising above adversities to defeat the odds |
Do you know how a team of just 6 girls fought hard their way
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Priyanka Bhaskar and 6 others.
message:
| A tale of perseverance and resilience – rising above adversities to defeat the odds |
Do you know how a team of just 6 girls fought hard their way to the title of Runner-up in a highly injury-prone sport? Do you know when was the last time KGP Women’s Basketball team had reached into the finals of Inter IIT Sports Meet? No, you might not be knowing! Let us tell you. It was 2004 and it’s after a gap of 13 years that these girls have repeated the same in style by winning the silver medal with an undefeated run till finals! But this journey has neither been a cakewalk nor they were served it easily on a platter. They upped their ante throughout the tournament and took it to another level when it mattered most.
In a fiercely contested contact sport which has high risks of players getting injured, the standard team size used to be 11 and the captain had requested for at least 10. But it was reduced to 9 since the administration felt that there is no need of those 2 extra players in a sport which didn’t have prospects of winning a medal. The Woes didn’t stop there. Out of 9 girls selected for the tournament, one of the most key players had to leave due to a medical emergency at her home. They lost their hopes for the tournament with their star player not being able to make it to the matches. Count goes to 8. One more player sustained an injury and couldn’t play. Count goes to 7. One player was in beginning stages and lacked in the experience that it takes to play at bigger stages. Effective count goes to 6. How do you play a sports tournament which requires 5 players and is highly injury prone? Justina Mathew, Ravali Madambakam, Silla Spandana, Saloni Kirdak, Swati Rawat and Remee Patel did the unthinkable! These six players played the entire tournament (5 matches) without having much luxury of getting substitutes. Out of these players, another key player had an injury in her thumb, which was later found to be a fragment fracture. But she didn't give up, she still took the risk and played all the matches. How about that for an example of perseverance? “A basketball team is like the five fingers on your hand. If you can get them all together, you have a fist.” And they proved so. They not only played, they also topped their pool and steamrolled opponent to reach all the way to finals with 4 wins out of 5 matches in their campaign. And along with winning hearts, they did manage to break the stereotype of basketball being the sport of only tall people. They did it all with good dribblers and long distance shooters.

In the first match itself, they were pitted against the hosts IIT Madras. Loud cheering, home supporters, taller players and what not! And guess what? They announced their arrival in style by beating the favourite hosts by 18-16. The team that no one was giving a chance to put up a fight has suddenly started looking threatening. As if that was not enough, their second successive win over IIT (ISM) Dhanbad by 15-8 sent a strong caution to the winds that they were here to stay, compete and win; not just to make up for the numbers. They gathered the momentum and their victory chariot didn’t stop there. In Quarter Finals, they comprehensively dribbled past IIT BHU by 23-19, sending shivers down the spine of opponents. It was an all-important Semi-Final clash with IIT Bombay. Stakes were high and odds were unfavourable but they rose to the occasion and delivered a nasty blow to Bombay’s hopes of going into Finals. It was tie neck to neck until the last moment when KGP got two free shots in the last 10 seconds of the match. The captain committed no mistake in firing them and the second one went in giving KGP a lead of one point. Can you believe that? A team which was being seen as the one participating just for formality and were no believers in them getting into knockout stages was into the finals! In the finals, they screamed, they ran ferociously, they dribbled hard, they threw all they had, they put each iota of energy their muscles could but credit to the opponents, they were simply better that day. As our players admitted, IIT Roorkee deserved the gold medal. Though they lost by 25-44, their entire campaign was studded with brilliant moments – the moments they can take pride on! It was nothing less than a roller coaster ride for them where they defied their own expectations and proved the pundits wrong. All the practice, hard work and perseverance bore sweet fruits.
It wasn’t their victory alone. It was also a big win for their coach Mr Soumen Mondal who played a pivotal role in motivating the team and strategizing for each match. He believed in them and always reminded them of their potential of getting a podium finish. As the players said, “Without his strategies, the victory wasn’t possible.” The never-say-die attitude of the team was all he wanted and girls didn’t disappoint him. The captain Remee marshalled her troop well and her leadership was the key to this entire campaign. A huge shout to these amazing girls!
What lies in the future? Most of the current players are graduating out. The team needs enthusiastic and dedicated junior players to fill the boots. As one of the players admitted, even during the practice sessions, participation from juniors was very less. They had a hard time choosing 9 players for the tournament. Participation from girls was utterly disappointing. And if that’s what will keep on going, we don’t stand a chance in rewriting histories in the upcoming Sports Meets. The current players have appealed to the girls to participate in as large numbers as possible. The sports scenario in KGP among girls isn’t in very good shape right now. We needed inspirations to look up to. Now that we have some of them, why to wait? Hit the ground on the very first day of the next semester!

short_message: We feel contented to announce that our team got selected to demonstrate a model in the International Semi-Finals of Masterpiece 2017 organised by Living
story: ProDex added 4 new photos — with Anjali Bharti and 5 others.
message: We feel contented to announce that our team got selected to demonstrate a model in the International Semi-Finals of Masterpiece 2017 organised by Living Talent held at Dubai from 13December,2017 to 18 December,2017. Our product Vibronot was shortlisted for the Grand Finale after a tough competition in the semi-finals and was adjudged as one of the best solution for controlling the Parkinson’s Disease.The model made by the team was staged by their representatives Anurag Goyaland Shyama Agrawal. The team got to interact with Mr. RoopamSharma (Top 8 innovators Under 35 in MIT technology review for his invention to replace braille language) and Mr. Mayur Ramgir (International award winning author) who are experts in the field of innovations and entrepreneurship. We applaud the whole team for their hard work inachieving a colossal platform.

short_message:
Registrations for Interrobang 2018 are now open!
Please register through this form if you will be needing accommodation at Interrobang 2018. Registration
message:
Registrations for Interrobang 2018 are now open!
Please register through this form if you will be needing accommodation at Interrobang 2018. Registration for the QuizFest is Rs. 800 per person. This covers accommodation (2 days + 1 night), breakfast on both days, and the registration fee for all 5 quizzes. (If you won't require accommodation, you can register for the quizzes on the spot). Rooms are limited and will be provided on a first-come, first-served basis.
If you require accommodation for a longer duration, please email us at quizzing@nalsar.ac.in BEFORE filling this form.
Rules, Regulations and Eligibility Criteria:
•Teams should consist of THREE members or less.
•Cross-college teams ARE allowed.
•The quiz is open to students pursuing full-time degrees from institutes that are affiliated to universities or are universities themselves.
•The quizzes are only for those doing their undergraduate degrees (this includes those enrolled in integrated Masters/PhDs) and postgraduate students born after 20th January, 1992.
•It is NOT open for teams from courses run by professional associations such as ICAI, ICSI etc. This list is merely indicative and NOT exhaustive.
•Participants pursuing degrees through distance mode learning are NOT eligible.
•Participants pursuing Diploma courses are NOT eligible.
Identification cards will have to be carried by all participants.

short_message: If you get a chance to choose your life again, will you do it differently? What is your purpose in life? “Many Dreams Many Lives”, a book written by our
message:
If you get a chance to choose your life again, will you do it differently? What is your purpose in life? “Many Dreams Many Lives”, a book written by our alumna Ms Viji Narayanan (Batch of 1991) follows an Indian women in America who’s emotionally charged self journey begs us to ask these same question over and over again. Cultural discord, marriage, relationship issues with in-laws, world view from different societies, mental health everything is covered in this book. The book will be available on Amazon bookstore in all countries from 11th January 2018 as a paperback print and digital download from Kindle.
Ms. Viji Narayanan graduated from the Architecture Department, IIT Kharagpur in 1991, is a software engineer and an emerging author with a love for a good story. She is also a bollywood buff who aspires to make this unique and compelling book into a Bollywood movie one day.
Watch this Book trailer on Youtube to know more about “Many Dreams Many Lives” - https://youtu.be/UXyqPOtC...

short_message:
The lifecycle of any start-up can be broadly divided into 3 stages:-

Stage 1: Problem-Solution Fit
The objective of this stage is to find
message:
The lifecycle of any start-up can be broadly divided into 3 stages:-

Stage 1: Problem-Solution Fit
The objective of this stage is to find a problem worth solving

Stage 2: Product-Market Fit
The objective of this stage is to build something people want and validate your business model

Stage 3: Scale After Product/Market
Here, your main objective is to SCALE.

We often see start-ups in the pursuit of Product-Market Fit without actually achieving Problem-Solution Fit. Adopting Lean startup methodologies is very essential for any early stage startup.
To develop MVP(Minimum Viable Product), Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur, & Zone Start-ups present Lean Start-up Drive.
Learn the mantras of excelling with the best possible output for you. Interact, ask and learn!
Venue: The Thought Factory, Bengaluru
Date & Time: 23rd December 2017 | 10 A.M
Register at: ecell-iitkgp.org/lsd

short_message: Greetings on behalf of Nurture.AI. We are pleased to inform you that Nurture.AI will be conducting AI Saturdays in Kharagpur. As we all know, that Artificial
message:
Greetings on behalf of Nurture.AI. We are pleased to inform you that Nurture.AI will be conducting AI Saturdays in Kharagpur. As we all know, that Artificial Intelligence is the new talk all over the world; why should Kharagpur stay behind! In this exciting initiative, open and free for all AI sessions will be conducted in Kharagpur. This will be conducted in sync with a worldwide audience across the United States, Singapore, and other Indian cities. Each session every Saturday will be divided into 3 parts where we will implement AI algorithms, discuss research papers, online material and have some interesting discussions.

The session will have a preliminary understanding of Python as a must and here are some resources to help you with that:
https://www.dataquest.io/ for a good guided Python introduction explanations and exercises: (Intro to Python available on free plan)

Python refresher + numpy+ matplotlib by Stanford ( https://github.com/kulesh... )

Pandas tutorials(https://bitbucket.org/hrojas/learn-pandas)

We are very glad to be a part of this and hope you too will benefit from this initiative.
The first session will be in January(tentatively on 13th January). All those interested kindly fill the registration form given below. The details regarding the sessions will be shared with the registered students soon. Also, this being a student initiative we request all interested research scholars and seniors to mentor us and help us make it a grand success.

Let us all join this wave of change and be a part of a global community comprising eminent researchers, PhDs, and students.

Sign-Up form:
https://goo.gl/forms/AluX7UZLVFL5bgIg1

For more details, contact:
Subham Rajgaria: 9830331068
Siddharth Singh: 8826219130

short_message: Over the last semester the Quiz Club has seen a flurry of activities, with numerous meetings in which quizzes from every possible genres were covered.
story: IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club added 7 new photos.
message:
Over the last semester the Quiz Club has seen a flurry of activities, with numerous meetings in which quizzes from every possible genres were covered. Apart from our regular meetings, the regulars of Quiz Club participated actively in quizzes being held in surrounding cities and secured numerous podium finishes there. Here we present to you a compilation of the achievements of the Quiz Club over the last semester.

Winners, Swedish India Nobel Memorial Quiz, Kolkata Round (team of Amit Kumar Ram, Piyush Kedia and Shreyans Sadangi)
Winners, NSSC Space Quiz at IIT Kharagpur (team of Amit Kumar Ram, Ashutosh Dwivedi, Mayank Roy)
1st Runner Up, NSSC Space Quiz at IIT Kharagpur (team of Baibhab Pattnaik)
2nd Runner Up, NSSC Space Quiz at IIT Kharagpur (team of Rishabh Madan, Sourav Kundu, Venkatesh Pai)
Winners, Prashnavali, General Quiz at IIEST Shibpur (team of Abhimanyu Bharade, Piyush Kedia)
2nd Runners Up, General Quiz at IIEST Shibpur (team of Baibhab Pattnaik, Shreyans Sadangi)
Winners, Quiz on the Beach, Kolkata Round (team of Abhimanyu Bharade and Piyush Kedia)
Winners, Kharagpur Open (team of team of Abhimanyu Bharade and Piyush Kedia)
Winners, General Quiz, XLRI Ensemble Valhalla, Jamshedpur (team of Ashutosh Dwivedi and Piyush Kedia)
Runners Up, General Quiz- Quizmat Qonnection, Scottish Church College, Kolkata (team of Amit Kumar Ram, Ashutosh Dwivedi and Shubham)
Runners Up, Biz Quiz, Intaglio at IIM Calcutta (team of Harsh Agarwal, Piyush Kedia and Shreyans Sadangi)
Runners Up, General Quiz, Intaglio at IIM Calcutta (team of Amit Kumar Ram, Harsh Agarwal and Piyush Kedia)

The IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club congratulates all the winners and hopes that the team continues their winning momentum as the Quiz contingent heads to IIT Kanpur for the Social Cultural Meet.

short_message: We are pleased to announce that the V Edition of Interrobang, NALSAR’s annual college Quiz Festival will be conducted on 20th and 21st January, 2018 at
message:
We are pleased to announce that the V Edition of Interrobang, NALSAR’s annual college Quiz Festival will be conducted on 20th and 21st January, 2018 at our campus in Shameerpet, Hyderabad. Over the past five years, Interrobang has become one of India’s biggest quiz festivals and this edition promises to deliver the same.

Over the weekend, we have got 5 quizzes lined up for college students with a fantastic prize pool in store. Headlining the event is Major Chandrakant Nair, who will be hosting two quizzes.

This is the line-up and schedule of Interrobang 2018:

20th January, 2018, 10 am: BizSciTech Quiz by Major Chandrakant Nair

20th January, 2018, 2 pm: MELAS Quiz by Jayavardhan Josyula and Siddharth Rajeevan

20th January, 2018, 6 pm: Attorney General Quiz by Balaji Subramanian and Anubhav Sachdeva (this is a written general quiz with a legal element to each question and is designed for non-law students)

21st January, 2018, 10 am: India Quiz by Lokesh Kaza

21st January, 2018, 2 pm: General Quiz by Major Chandrakant Nair

The eligibility criteria for college students can be checked out on our event page at https://www.facebook.com/events/1969612729926441/.

We shall announce details pertaining to registration and prize money break-up shortly on the event page. We suggest that you book your tickets well in advance and hope to see you attend in great numbers.

See you in Janauary! Any queries may be addressed to quizzing@nalsar.ac.in.

short_message: A workshop on Product Engineering and IP Commercialisation was conducted by Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur in association with RMoSEE. We saw participation
story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
A workshop on Product Engineering and IP Commercialisation was conducted by Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur in association with RMoSEE. We saw participation from Prodex, Technology Transfer Group, RGSOIPL and RMoSEE. The speaker, Mr. Kameshwar Eranki, Founder and CEO, VajraSoft Inc.,USA, threw light on the impact of disruptive technologies on future markets and the ease of management of one's Intellectual Property through technological advancements.
Additionally, a hands-on demo was shown to the participants in areas of Reverse Engineering, 3D Printing and Rapid Prototyping.

short_message:
Hello KGP. Here is a beginner's guide to the field of Machine Learning and Data Analytics.

Here are few of the resources for learning and implementations
message:
Hello KGP. Here is a beginner's guide to the field of Machine Learning and Data Analytics.

Here are few of the resources for learning and implementations :
1. Machine Learning by Andrew Ng - https://www.coursera.org/...
2. The Analytics Edge - edX - https://www.edx.org/cours...
3. Python for Machine Learning - Udemy - https://www.udemy.com/dat... (Can see preview for free)
4. Deep Learning - https://www.coursera.org/...
5. An introduction to statistical learning in R-ISLR - https://github.com/tpn/pd... (ISLR%20Sixth%20Printing).pdf
6. Machine learning by Yaser Abu Mostafa cs-156 - A little math intensive.

P.S: 2nd & 3rd year UG students interested to join KDAG for this academic year can solve the following problem statement and send their report in Ipython Notebook/R Markdown to iitkdag@ gmail.com by 31st Dec 2017.

message:
Do you have an idea that can revolutionize mobility? Do you have an idea that can compete with the Hyperloop? If yes, here is your chance to showcase your talents. The French Embassy in India is organizing Easy Ride, a 2-day hackathon on the theme of smart and sustainable mobility. Easy Ride is a prototype and design competition that brings together teams of creative and ingenious students to come with innovative solutions on the theme of Smart and Sustainable Mobility.

short_message: The countdown is over! Kharagpur Winter of Code is now taking student registrations.
message:
The countdown is over! Kharagpur Winter of Code is now taking student registrations.

https://kwoc.kossiitkgp.i...

KWoC is a December long online program. For those who already know about Google Summer of Code, KWoC is going to be very helpful for you. Register yourself as a student and the instructions will follow you. For those who don't know about such open source programs, KWoC is a platform where you are going to learn about a new style of collaborative software development. Read more on the website.

In simple steps:
- Register yourself.
- Go through the projects.
- Choose one/two you want to work on.
- Contact the mentor of the project.
- Contribute !

Feel free to reach us anytime.

With ❤️
- KOSS

short_message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post.

In the wake of the recent tragic events that took
story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post.

In the wake of the recent tragic events that took place in KGP, Students’ Alumni Cell has taken an initiative along with IITKGP Foundation to raise INR 39 L ($60,000) to bring in state-of-the-art ambulance for safe and reliable medical care while en route to facilities in Kolkata. The surplus money raised will be used for student wellness and health on campus (namely mental health services).
'Alumni are an integral part of the institute.' True to our notions, they have always been a helping hand to KGP and have contributed significantly to its development over the years, be it the Nalanda Classroom complex or halls' development. It is in tough times like these, the true spirit of KGP emerges forth where the entire KGP family unites as a whole. As it is said in RK Hall, “A Great Place to Learn and Live,” let us make KGP a great place to learn and live.
#for_a_better_kgp
#every_help_counts

Hey KGP!
The time for downloading our endsem admit cards is here. Alas, we cannot do the same without filling a feedback form. Most of us would love
message:
Hey KGP!
The time for downloading our endsem admit cards is here. Alas, we cannot do the same without filling a feedback form. Most of us would love to do it, if we could read responses for the courses we fill too, rather than only an accolade by the director.

So we have gone ahead and created a course page for every course that IIT KGP offers out there. But we'd like your help in adding a review for the course. Please add a small summary for your course you have taken this semester and help enlighten the rest of us. Popular optional courses such as electives, will be shared by us for Spring 2018 registrations to help you all out.

https://goo.gl/forms/HmuV...

Come by, say hello and hangout with us at metakgp.slack.com .

short_message: Balakalakaar, an event organized AIESEC in IIT Kharagpur, in association with Sparsh, an NGO based in Sakchi, Jamshedpur, was held on Sunday, 12th of November
message:
Balakalakaar, an event organized AIESEC in IIT Kharagpur, in association with Sparsh, an NGO based in Sakchi, Jamshedpur, was held on Sunday, 12th of November at Gurukul School, Gurabanda, Jharkhand. It was an event which provided an opportunity to the children in the remote rural settlement to express their talents in art, dance, drama, and singing. Another different aspect of this edition was that children just didn't perform, their performances were also based on social evils like child marriage, dowry, gender inequality etc. which still prevail in their villages , and we are sure such an event will create a difference in the mindsets of the people, and motivate them to break free of these traditions.
The event saw the participation of over 70 children and was spectated by their parents and other residents of the village. Shri. Kunal Sarangi, Member of Legislative Assembly, Government of Jharkhand, was the Chief Guest of the event.
On this Children's day, we take this opportunity to present you few glimpses of Balakalakaar 2017.
Because ' Smiles are what we live for!'

short_message:
Greetings from Technology Students' Gymkhana!

The Smart India Hackathon (SIH) was a national level effort connecting the higher education campuses.
message:
Greetings from Technology Students' Gymkhana!

The Smart India Hackathon (SIH) was a national level effort connecting the higher education campuses. The SIH was primarily a code-fest in which software programmers were challenged to write programmes giving innovative solutions to more than 500 problem statements. The SIH-2017 elicited an enthusiastic response with more than 40,000 students participating. It was concluded in the first week of April 2017 with Hon’ble PM addressing the participants. This is being followed with Smart India Hackathon-2018 which was formally launched details of which can be found in https://innovate.mygov.in/sih2018/.

The MHRD now proposes to expand the scope of SIH-2018 by including hardware section in it. This platform will provide an opportunity to the innovative minds to showcase their solutions at the national level. It is also proposed that the best entries at the national level would also be provided funding through the Research Parks and the Technology Business Incubators (TBIs) for product development for their eventual commercialisation/extensive social use.

The MHRD expects a good participation in this Hackathon from all the IITs and NITs.
All students are requested to provide ideas (with or without models/prototypes) that will be proposed as problem statements of the Smart India Hackathon 2018. This should be done by mailing the idea totech.gymkhana@gmail.com by 13th November, 2 AM.

You are also requested to go through the 400+ problem statements provided in the aforementioned link and register for the Hackathon. The problem statements are both software and hardware based.

short_message: As they all say, 'The pen is mightier than the sword', Business Club, IIT Kharagpur in association with the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) brings to you an
message:
As they all say, 'The pen is mightier than the sword', Business Club, IIT Kharagpur in association with the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) brings to you an outstanding opportunity to showcase your writing talent.
Participate in this essay writing competition with your team of 3-4 members and submit an essay of 2000 words on the topic 'Can FinTech revolutionise access to finance in India?' The zonal round will be held in Kolkata on 2nd February, 2018. The winning team stands a chance to win Rs 1,00,000/- and a 3-month internship opportunity in RBI in any department of their choice. The team placed second would receive a cash prize of Rs 50,000/- while the other two national finalists would receive a cash prize of Rs 25,000/-. The regional and zonal finalists shall be awarded a cash prize of Rs 10,000/- and Rs 15,000/- respectively. The last date of submission is 5th December, 2017.

Head over to this link to register: http://tinyurl.com/RBI-PC...

short_message:
YourDost is finally here guys!

YourDOST is an online counseling and emotional support platform designed to foster mental wellness
message:
YourDost is finally here guys!

YourDOST is an online counseling and emotional support platform designed to foster mental wellness

Here are the steps you need to follow for registration:
1) Please visit the site( www.yourdost.com ).
Make sure you are connected to the IIT kgp wifi, only then you access the services for free. Although once you are registered from here, you can use its services from anywhere.
2) You can sign up with any email id and put up any username of your choice. There are various career experts, life coaches and counsellors present. You can anonymously chat with any of them.
3) Voice call and video call can also be arranged by booking an appointment from website itself.

Every chat, voice and video call is accessible and it's totally an anonymous platform.
